1323322222111111.content:
"Mabel. No. Stop." Stan yelled at his great-niece as he held out a large sack in front of his customers which they mindlessly chucked money in at the sight of one of their own being suffocated.

Mabel ignored it and held the total cutie to her chest like he'd vanish if she let go. Hopping from one foot to the other as she listed all the things they could do as a couple while his face purpled. Going both blue from the lack of oxygen and red from how deep he was being held into the thick sweater and thick cleavage.

Wendy's jaw hung loosely at the site of the girl as her brother strode over to pull her apart from the poor lucky guy. This was Mabel?! That nurse from Animaniacs had a less impressive figure than this girl!

Her legs were long and went into.....you know what. Let's get this out of the way first.

Those were the biggest f**king TITS she'd ever seen in her entire life!

Usually, people leave them at the end of their description of another woman and even then dance around the subject, but they were so huge they 'demanded' to be first! Yeah yeah sure, the rest of her was curvy and everything, but what that drew everyone in the room except her family's attention was the girl's gargantuan Majumbos! She was as stacked as her brother was buff!

When some cocky ass perv bragged about seeing a girl with breasts bigger than their head, they don't quite realize 'how' large that would have to be. Yet now Wendy had a perfect idea of that if not more because when those guys talk about it they usually mean that the total mass of both boobs 'combined' was bigger than the girl's head. not that each 'individual' boob was bigger than their head!

She'd question (and kind of hope) if they were fake, but she was too worried that the answer was probably no.

She was glad that the hottest guy she'd ever met was the new girl's brother and not her boyfriend.

She shook that thought out.

With a quick tug, Dipper pulled the air starved guy out of his sister's bosom with a deep gasp. The girl staggered back a little and landed on her plush butt sending her giant tata's quaking so much if she were wearing anything but a bulky sweater it would have torn open

"Hey, what's the big idea!?"

"Great uncle Stan doesn't need to be sued because you nearly murdered a guy on day one Mabel." He folded his arms across his broad chest. It wasn't as interesting an action as it would be if his sister did it, but it drew the attention of more than a few of the female tourists.

"Whatever. " She grunted and dusted herself off

"I'm serious Mabel. Your not a little kid anymore. You can't just latch onto the nearest guy you think is cute and expect them to just smile about it."

"Uh hello." She gestured to herself "Have you met me? I'm Mabel Pines. Hottest girl in Piedmont. No man can resist me. Isn't that right sweetie?" She asked the empty space where her new boyfriend had been.

"Eh?" She looked around "Where'd he go?"

"Oh, he ran off while you two were arguing. Stan got him up the moment you said sue."

The brunette disgested the words, then seemed to fold in on herself "Seriously? Again?"

Again? Wendy would have found it hard to believe someone who looked like Mabel would have a hard time getting a guy. Then again if she smothered every guy she met then maybe it wasn't that hard to believe.

Now that she got a good look at her, it really didn't match up with everything below the neck. While her body radiated sexual hotness in waves, her face was 'cute', possibly even 'adorable'. Her cheeks were still as pinchable as a granny would like and had a button nose that was begging to be 'booped'. She was a teenager yet If all you saw of her was her face then you could easily mistake her for a girl a few years younger than she was

"Eh, I wouldn't worry about it. With how regular we get tourists your bound to see a cute boy or two at least twice a day."

Her head whipped back up to look at the lumber jane "Really?! Score! Mabel is BACK on top!"

Dipper sighed "And once again she learns nothing."

Wendy waved him off "Let her enjoy herself for now. It'll be easier for when Stan puts you both to work." She smiled up at him.

She smiled back.

Mabel stopped jumping and looked at the two.

The way her cheeks blew up as she looked at the two didn't make her look any less immature

"Hey! How come you get to get a girlfriend on day one but I don't get to keep my new boy toy?!"

The two blinked. Looked at each other then backed off.

"It's not."

"I'm not....."

"Oh come on! Your at that stage already?....not fair." She pouted.

They laughed again. Wendy chuckled and held out her hand.

"Wendy Corduroy. Your great uncle's cashier."

"Mabel Pines. Future world-famous artist." The girl smiled back.

"You mind if I ask you a question?"

"Their real." The Pines girl said automatically.

"Are you ser!?.... I mean no. A different question."

"What?"

"What are you two eating and where can I get some?" She asked dead serious.

"Huh. Grunkle Stan asked the same thing earlier."

"That makes sense."
1323322222111111.title: Maboobs

1323322222112.content: Ok then. Who is the teenager and the pre-teenager?
1323322222112.title: One of them is the older sibling

132332222212.content: What if during 'Carpet Diem' the carpet was lost and they were trapped as each other?
132332222212.title: Carpet Diem?

1323322222122.content:
I'm a big fan of this AU.......buuuut lets give it a little twist.

What if Dipper was a Cervitaur and Mabel was a mermaid.........'before' coming to Gravity Falls?
1323322222122.title: Monster Falls

choices: Restart with them both monsters from the start.
13233222221221.content:
Hooves tore apart the ground apart as they thundered through. Ripping up grass and splintering wood from the sheer force put into the sprint. The sound of the run would echo throughout the woods if it weren’t for the enormous, ground shaking footsteps drowning it out..

The girl had her arms wrapped around the boy and held on for dear life, screamed in terror in his floppy ear as he pushed his four legs as hard as he moved.

“RUN FASTER!!!”

“IT’S NOT RUNNING! IT’S GALLOPING!”

“I KNOW! I JUST DIDN’T SAY IT IN CASE IT OFFENDED YOU!”

“NOW’S NOT THE TIME FOR POLITICAL CORRECTNESS, BUT I APPRECIATE THE GESTURE!”

See that centaur doing all the galloping? Wait why am I even asking that? It’s a centaur of course you see it. I mean how can you not notice a guy with a deer where his butt should should be? Though technically since the lower half is a deer and not a horse it’s actually a ‘cervitaur’ and, ok ok I get it not a good time for semantics. Moving on.

Anyway, that centaur you obviously see? That’s me. Dipper Pines. The girl who apparently ate one too many cookies recently and sitting on my back (doing a poor job of not looking like she’s enjoying the free pony ride I might add) it is my sister Mabel.

You may be wondering why I’m running full ‘gallop’ through the woods while being chased by that giant shadowy creature of unimaginable horror. We’ll lets rewind a little.

It all started the other….wait, wait…..I think we need a little more context than that.

-------

August 31, 1999

A woman lies on her back in a bed moaning and screaming in the way only one going through the quote unquote miracle of birth would understand. Beside her trying very hard not to whimper as the hand he’s being forced to hold makes the bones in his own audibly creak is the man who helped her get to this state.

‘Now if it wasn’t obvious, these are our parents. And the tiny screaming bundle in the cradle in the corner is Mabel. Me?’

“AAAGGGHHH!!!”

‘Give it a minute.’

“AAAAGGGGHHHH!!!”

“Just breath Mrs Pines.”

“%&^$ YOU, YOU &*%^$£( %^$*ER! YOU TRY TO PUSH A %£$*ING LITTLE %$£% OUT!!!”

“Ok and push!”

“AAAGGGHHH!!!”

“Push!”

“AAAGGGHHH!!!

“I can see the head! Push!”

“AAAGGHHH!!!”

“Just one more Mrs Pines! Push!”

“AAAAAGGGGHHHH!!!”

“Good girl. There we go a nice healthy OH MY GOD!!!!”

The midwife’s exclamation shocked the couple enough that the woman let go of her husbands abused hand. He got up just in time to see the woman keel backwards baby in toe, managing to grab their little….whatever before she hit the ground.

Mr Pines looked over the midwife and breathed a sigh of relief she looked ok. Thank you exspensive shag carpeting. Seeing that the man was safe he turned his attention to the baby to see what the problem was.

‘It took them 10 minutes to realise I was a boy. Though considering it only took them 5 seconds to realise there was a small deer torso were chubby baby legs should be, and 20 seconds for that to sink in, I’d say I’d say not knowing my gender for a few minutes was reasonable.

--------------------

It was a ‘really’ good thing that my mom wanted us to ‘be born in our warm and loving home rather than a cold and sterile hospital’, or else I’d be giving this monologue from behind a two way mirror with some guy in a lab coat poking me with a stick.

They ‘somehow’ managed to convince the midwife not to tell the world about the mutant deer boy. Though I’m pretty sure it must have involved a lot of money or a lot of bullcrap. Though even with her promising not to run to the press, or a symposium or anything that was only really the first of the many, many, many questions my bizarre birth brought up. How was this possible? why didn’t my legs show up on ultrasound? why was Mabel not a doe girl?

Really the only question it answered was why mom kept eating the flowers dad brought home.

Of course there was the biggest question. What were they going to do with me? You couldn’t raise someone who was half boy half petting zoo attraction in the middle of suburbia. But neither of their jobs were things they could just uproot at a moments notice. Conveniantly I just so happened to have a great uncle who lives in a cabin in the woods in the middle of nowhere.

Fast forward twelve year from here to just the other day.

The day I met my sister.
13233222221221.title: Secret origins of Deerper Pines

132332222212211.content:
The bus pulled off from the oh so rarely used stop outside the old forest. Leaving behind a cloud of dust, a little girl dressed like she was ready for winter despite it being the start of summer and a luggage carrier so colourful it hurt to look at.

She took in a deep breath and exhaled.

“Ok Mabel, let’s do this.” She grabbed the handle of her rather large luggage case and started pulling it up the dirt path into the dark, scary woods, past the signs reading ‘?’ and ‘what’.

It had been a complete accident that she found it. She’d blown her allowance on that bulk order of wool she used to make the sweater she was wearing now, so she had to raid the house for old scraps for her parents anniversary gift. Now that mind sound tacky, in fact to most people that most is tacky, but Mabel was the kind of child whose sheer adorableness allowed her to do things like this without being seen as too old for such gifs.

She’d searched high and low, every corner of every room. Every discarded newspaper. Every opened envelope. She looked in closets, boxes, the basement. However as she was looking over the top of her mom’s dresser, something slipped out from between the wallpaper roll and a twenty year old monopoly set weighed down by a foot of dust. A picture she really should never have found.

It was a picture of great uncle (or Grunkle as she liked to call him) Stan. Not anything she hadn’t seen before. It looked really recent as well . It was a sort of close up of him. He standing in front of his awesome sauce cabin/ weird museum with a giant hairless beaver, a boy who looked almost exactly like her, and a red haired girl dressed like a lumberjack. All mugging for the camera.

Smiling she’d put the picture back and went down to join her parents for lunch. Finishing the meal peacefully, and then letting rip an ear splitting “WHAT?” when they had loaded up their arms with dishes.

It took a little bit of weedling, but once she showed them the photo they broke down. She had a brother.

She had a twin.

Once the squeeing died down with her sugar crash they managed to sit her down and explain. Dipper (Or at least that was the name he insisted he be called by, given his…’other’ name she understood completely) had been sent to live with Grunkle Stan at almost the moment they were born cause of some rare ‘condition’ he had. They wouldn’t tell her what it was, but it meant it would have made it difficult for him to live in the city.

She had begged them to let her visit him. Like literal hands and knees begging, with big puppy dog eyes and quivering lip. She was mildly shocked that they were able to resist and flat out turn her down. Telling her that she wasn’t ready to meet her brother yet. When she asked when she’d be ready they responded….

“When your older.”

“How much older?”

“Older than your mom or me.”

Mabel would say she was rather displeased with that answer. In fact she might go as far to say she was quite displeased indeed…..in fact she couldn’t remember a time she was more displeased than she was now.

So displeased in fact that she raided her dads wallet during the night, packed up as much of her stuff as she could wheel out and caught book herself on a bus out of state at the crack of dawn. It was surprisingly easy with it being the start of summer and there were parents eager to send their children out of state as it was already. All she needed to do was get on with some other kids close enough that the driver wouldnt ask questions. She was an hour out of California before she thought she may have made a stupid.

If she had to do math, she guessed she had a good….ehhhhhh….the second she gets to the shack before she finds her parents on the other side of the door ready to whisk her back home and lock her in the basement til she was 37.

At least she’d get to see her bro.

“Uuuuhhh so, heavy. Why did I pack 20 pounds of glitter? It’s not ‘that’ isolated out here, it’s not like I couldn’t buy some in town.”

The case fell from her fingers into the dirt right before she flopped onto it. She’d been walking down this weird path forever and she still couldn’t see the shack. he found her gaze turning up to the sky. Looked like the clouds where in a match with the sun to see whether or not it rained, and here she was with her coat in a case with a sticky zipper and buried under ten more sweaters.

“....I wonder what he’s like.” She said to herself. It occoured to her that she hadn’t thought about who this guy she was dying to meet actually was. She’d spent the entire bus ride thinking “ I HAVE A BROTHER! I HAVE A BROTHER! I HAVE A BROTHER!”, but didn’t stop to think that she knew next to nothing about him except his name.

“Pffft what are you worried about Mabel. Your ‘awesome’ at talking to boy’s, even if they are your brother. Just treat it like your meeting a new boyfriend and you’ll be fine……….ok that sounded waaaaay less awkward in my head.”

“Yeah not something you really wanna say out loud.”

She shot back up….or at least tried to, but with the way she was lying on the case she ended up tumbling onto the dirty, dirty ground.

*Hack Hack* She spewed up some dirt and got back to her feet. Though not before getting an eye on a pair of heavy work boots.

Not one ounce of the red hairs clothing was feminine. An oversized plaid shirt, loose fit jeans and oh oh oh one of those adorble floppy ear far that made you look like a puppy I want it I want...*ahem* focus Mabel.

The girl looked far too pretty to be wearing such manly cloths, but at the same time seemed to fit them perfectly.

“You don’t look like your conventional tourist. You lost.”

“Nope. Looking for the mystery shack.” She held out a hand in greeting “Name’s Mabel.”

“Wendy.” She took the hand “So what’s a non tourist doing looking for that road side dump?”

“Oh nothing much. See the sights. Having a summer romance. Reuniting with her long lost twin brother, Adding to her enormous knick knack collection,. That sort of thing.”

The elder girl nodded her head “Cool that’s….wait. Long lost twin brother? You don’t mean Dipper do you?” The girl questioned...and then she looked the younger girl up and down, stopping several times on her legs for some reason.

“I dunno. You know any other twelve year old boys who live in an isolated shack in the woods of this tiny little town?” She asked with a smile sweeter than sugar.

“I……that sentence. It’s clearly sarcastic, but the tone is way too sincere. I can’t tell if your kidding or not!”

“Yeah I get that a lot.” She smiled “So you know my bro-bro and grunkle right?” She asked as she picked up the handle of her case and tried to resume dragging it before it was lifted up effortlessly by the unusually powerful arms of the teenage girl.

“Since I was eight. I’m doing a sentence there for summer cash right now.”

“Awesome. Lead the way!”
132332222212211.title: Mabel poorly thought out quest

1323322222122111.content:
The shack looked terrible. The timber in it’s frame were either ritting or cover in moss. The sign was damaged and had a giant S just waiting for some unlucky rube to stand under it so it could crush them. Windows were cracked, and there was a goat chewing on some fat guys pants while he was trying to fix the outside toilet.

“Oh my gosh. This. place. looks. INCREDIBLE!”

“Oh it’s incredible alright.” The older girl snarked, spotting a group of people armed with cameras, out of place hawaiian shirts and badly guarded wallets entering the museum part doors. “Just great.” She sighed “Listen I gotta go woman the register in the gift shop. You gonna….wait where’d?” She said to the empty space that once contained a little girl, before spotting her moving inside with the tour group.

---------------------------

“WWoooowww.” It was all so tacky and fake looking. It was like all her arts and crafts dreams coming true at once!

“Step right up folks! Be amazed at the genuine wonders found only in my house of mystery!”

She knew that voice anywhere. Like someone had been gargling sand and cigarettes for half their life. Racing up to meet the group she recognised her ‘Grunkle’ Stan instantly. The heavy built mature gentlemen in a dusty suit and ratty old fez was busy doing what he did best. Razzling and sometimes even dazzling patron’s of his establishment with fantastic tales of his many adventures and exhibits.

“And here we have the terror of Canada! The horrific beast that gummed a trail of death and destruction from Toronto to some other french sounding city. The great toothless beaver!”

An old curtain was pulled away, revealing a ratty old stuffed beaver with it’s prominent teeth removed surrounded by signs covered in question marks. It wasn’t just fake. It was cheap fake. The kind of fake that wouldn’t fool the biggest idiot in the remedial class of the dumbest school.

Fortunately for Stanford Pines, the shack accomodated for a ‘special’ kind of idiot. The Tourist.

The camera snapping, crowd ate it up like it was a chicken dinner and literally throwing money at the ratty former decoration.

“That's right folks. Make sure to save some to buy your very own mini toothless beaver figurine. All yours for only £39.95 before tax.”

She could practically see the money leaping into her great uncles sweaty palms like wallet shaped salmon.

“And over here we have a rare picture of the mythical Goat riding a walrus while playing the banjo! How is it possible? Why is the walrus letting the goat ride it? How did a goat get that far into the frozen north? How can it play a banjo with hooves? It’s crazy am I right?!”

She followed behind the group with just as much awe and wonder as the families he continued to bleed dry. Amazed at how cheap and fake everything was. Showing them poorly carved wood sculptures, hastily glued folk art and paintings where the canvas was still wet. Until he brought the group to a spot near the end of the exibits blocked off by a large red curtain. The kids in the group started to get a giddy look in their eye.

“And now folks! The moment you’ve all been waiting for! The star attraction of the Mystery Shack! The culmination of my years of painstaking adventure and research into mystery! The last of his kind! The PRRRINCE of the forest!”

“The Majestic Deer Boy!”
1323322222122111.title: Mystery Shack

13233222221221111.content:
The curtains part over my own stall and she heard a startled gasp from the tourists. Pushing through she just managed to make out a boy in front of them with one hand on his waist and the other on a carved and shamany looking wood staff that totally went with the inked on tribal tats he had on his chest and arms.

There he was. Her brother. He looked even more like her in person than he did the picture.

She didn’t really understand why her brother dressed like a cliche native american was level 3 gasp worthy from anyone but her, until she went round and got a better look.

From the waist down rather than deer skin pants, it was just deer. He stood on four spindly legs that were longer and thinner than any human leg with hooves that clicked against the floor with every step. Atop his head was a crown of majestic antlers that made him look like a real prince of the forest.

He stood there trying to look proud and magnificant. Unfortunatly he also had big floppy ears, a smattering of freckles on highly pinchable cheeks and a cute little tail that wiggled from side to side, soooooo……

“Awwww”

“He’s so cute.”

“Oooh look at his little tail.”

“Don’t his antlers make him look so manly. Yes they do, they do.”

“Mama can I pet the deer boy?”

Even if he tried to maintain his ‘proud warrior man’ look, it was as easy to see how annoyed he was at the reaction.

“Ah ah ah no petting kids. We don’t want to startle the prince do we. He spooks easily.”

More likely he didn’t want them to find out those not so hidden zippers and crude stitches. Though she had to admit he looked adorable. Camera phone, flashless click, save but do ‘not’ send...yet.

Stan gives them his ‘story’, about how he found me injured in the woods in some far off land and brought me here to nurse me back to health, and in exchange I would bless him with eternal wealth, which is why he was ‘blessed’ to have such wonderful customers. That got a laugh along with several fistfuls of cash thrown into nearby buckets. The old man wow’d them for a little longer before leading them off, the curtain falling back in place.

Mabel hung back, neither the group or curator noticing while she ducked under the velvet rope. Wait is this even velvet? Mmm Texture is off, and it feels like….! That dirty….this is old felt! There’s cheap and then theirs cheap, but this is just, just WRONG! You can’t just fake a velvet rope, it goes against like, all the laws of glamourousness! I outta….wait what was that?

She filed away her outrage at the crime against extravagence for now and inched towards the not so silk curtain. Peeking her eye through she saw the adoraboy slouching forward..

“Agh.” He rubbed the small of his human back. “Being majestic hurts.”

“It’s the price you pay to be awesome dude.” The chubby handyman commented as he picked up the money buckets and hauled them in back before grabbing a plaid shirt and tossing it at the boy.

He didn’t like that he could no longer wear t-shirts or anything that required to be pulled over the head. Thats the price he guessed he had to pay to have this regal crown he ha….

“Antlers slipping dude.”

“Ah.” He gasped and reached up, shifting his regal crown til it sat straight. Only to let out a human and totally not deer like bleet as the crown was ripped from his skull and a fat hand started mussing up his hair.

"You totally killed today. They must have thrown like half their wallets in here. Doing your uncle proud."

"He'll probably just whine that they didn't throw more."

"Probably but....woah!" The older man gasped before shoving the Antlers back onto the boys head.

"OW. Hey what the big....." He went quiet when he noticed Soos looking past his shoulder. He looked behind him and spotted a girl his age wearing a sweater at the height of summer?

"Uh hey. Didn't see you in the group. Must have shoved you to the back."

She continued to stare at him. It was nothing new.

"We'll...." He held his arms out wide. Trotting around a little before coming to a stop. "Here I am. Prince of the forest and whatever. Blessing the shack with my graceful presence."

She kept staring at him. Ok this was getting kind of creepy.

“Look the tours already moved ahead so if you want to ask something and catch up…”

She tackled him in a hug.

“OH MY GOSH!!! YOU LOOK SO ADORABLE!”

“AH! GREAT UNCLE STAN! IT’S HAPPENING AGAIN!”
13233222221221111.title: The Deer boy

132332222212211111.content:
He didn’t even get halfway through the sentence before a man in his late sixties wearing a fez burst through the doorway swinging a baseball bat in every direction except the one he needed to.

“FOR THE LAST TIME YOU CAN’T TAKE HIM HOME WITH YOU! NOT FOR THAT FEW AN AMOUNT OF ZEROS!”

“Hey grunkle Stan.”

“Huh? Oh hey Mabel. Wait just a second sweety while I deal with some………” The bat clattered to the floor as he pulled down his glasses and rubbed his eyes. “You get the call. You know she’s coming, and you still reach for the baseball bat. Your gettin’ old Stan.”

The boys ears folded down. “Uncle Stan what’s going on? Who is this?”

The old man sighed deeply and turned around, gesturing to Mabel in a dramaticlly serious manner. “Dipper it isn’t in my nature as a salesmen and a convicted felon to be straightforward about anything. But this girl. We’ll she….it’s sorta...y’know sometimes with the mom and dad. Sometimes there’s more than one ‘miracle’ and….”

“I’M YOUR BIG SISTER!” She squee’d with a powerful hug.

He looked up at the man who raised him with a blank expression. Who averted his eyes and nodded sheepishly in response.

“I...have a big sister?”

“Uh yup yup! A whole five minutes older. Were twins!”

The boy stared at her for a moment before turning and looking at his uncle blankly

“I have...a ‘twin’ sister?”

“Can we cut the third repitition of that question so you can just get to the yelling?” The old man asked.

“And you never thought to TELL ME!?!?!”

“I was gonna, eventually. I just didn’t want you to, y’know get any idea’s in your head. I mean you think I feel awkward now? Me and yer folks have been trying to go over what to say for years.”

The girl didn’t seem to notice the increase amounts of discomfort in the room as she held onto the boy for deer life, nuzzling his cheek against hers like he was a pig. “Whats your favourite colour? Mine’s rainbow. Do you love glitter. Wait don’t answer that, of course you do! Whats school like here. Do you have a racoon for a pet? Can I name it bandit? How do you walk in that costume? Do you like chocolate or vanilla frosting on your cake?

“Whoah whoah one question at a...wait what do you mean how do I *OOF*?!”

The boy looked at the mass of hair hugging the air of of his lungs and tugging at his ears with one eye cocked. It took one overly cheerful look from his uncle for the other brow to raise and the expression to go from confused to silently screaming in his own head.

“It’s….complicated.”

“Works for me!” She turned back to Stan “Now since I just forced a situation that can’t just be hushed up and forgotten about by immediately shipping me back to California, I trust I’ll be staying in one of my great uncles many luxurious spare rooms for the foreseeable future. Maybe even bunking with my bro bro. Hint and a wink.”

“Oh wow. Her powerful skills at negotiation and charming have like totally convinced me your related Mr Pines.”

“Shut up Soos.”

“Shutting up.”
132332222212211111.title: Meeting Family

1323322222122111111.content:
While a situation such as this would normally have caused business to be closed for the day to deal with all the drama, Stanford Pines wouldn’t have shut the shack even if the world was ending. So instead of leading the kids to the living room and having a long drawn out heart to heart, he slapped a Mystery Shack visor on his great niece’s head and shoved her into the next room with Wendy to help sell more merchandise.

“You can have feelings later. I got bills to ignore and expensive tastes to fulfill.”

The two clearly had more to say, but Dipper knew that when it came to money there was no talking to him. So he dragged himself back up onto his stage and looked regal for the camera.

Mabel was given incredibly heavy boxes by the man and continually move them about the shop with little to no reason behind it before ditching the two.

“Uuuhhh these are so heavy. What's in these things anyway? Rocks?” She groaned before tripping over a loose floorboard. The top box tipped off the stack and fell to the floor. Spilling dozens of odd shaped rocks with question marks crudely painted on them across the floor.

Wendy laughed “One of our best sellers.” She laughed before picking them up and tossing them haphazardly onto a shelf marked ‘Mystery Rocks’.

Mabel dragged herself into the kitchen where her Grunkle was having a late breakfast in between his tours. She walked slmped against the wall, she used the surface as a guide towards her location in leu of opening her eyes, as she was determined to get as much sleep as possible. One of the many things she did not factor on, on her poorly factored plan. That little sleep and hard work made you tired

She stumbled into the kitchen, groaning and holding her back. Stan looked over his paper for a second and chuckled. Mumbling something about her waiting a few decades for whole new kinds of back ache.

Stan didn't even bother looking up again. "Ok so I called your parents....."

"How mad are they?" She mumbled as her face planted on the table into a brick of cold, cold butter.

"It was more like 'yell through the phone at your dad' because your moms yelling in the background made it hard to speak to each other."

A burbling sound came from the slowly meling yellow brick where her mouth was.

"Your not being punished right now. But only because they can't decide on 'infinite grounding' or 'military school'. So for the time being their letting you stay. But I wouldn't count on a summer long adventure.

It was a better deal than she'd hoped for, she supposed. With herculean effort, the little sweater girl lifted herself into a slightly to tall chair and pulled up a box of cereal. Grimacing a little at the 'sugerless, unfrosted laxa-o's- the breakfast of 'regular' champion' she poured herself a bowl for the lack of anything better and dug in. Taking two bites before she noticed the boy next to her. She noticed two things that were off.

One. He was still wearing his costume. He'd put on a shirt and washed off the tattoos. Had a blue and white hat on instead of those antlers, but he was still wearing the deer parts.

Secondly.....

“Are you eating a salad for breakfast?”

Dipper stopped chewing and Stan pulled the paper down. They both glance at the bowl, then to her.

The owner of the shack cracks a smile. “Yeah. Crazy huh? kids a total health freak. I try to get him to eat bacon one time and what does he do? All over my new shoes.”

“Ok first off those things haven’t been new since the Reagan administration. Secondly I told you I couldn’t eat animal products.”

“I heard that all the time in the sixties kid. How was I supposed to know you, your parents and that doctor meant it literally?”

She looked at the contents of his bowl. She saw lettuce, carrots, peppers and..........

"Is that grass and pine needles?"

He bolked in his mouth. Shooting her a shocked look before....eeewww....swallowing.

"I'm uh, really dedicated to my diet."

She was unsure but didn't chase it. Turning back to her old man cereal.

She had two spoonfuls before she decided she'd had enough forever. Looking over to her bro-bro she smiled.

"So. You not have any pants? If you need to wear that costume now you totally must have any."

"Nope." He stated bluntly.

She frowned. It was an expression that didn’t look like it belonged on her face. Slowly she walked over to him, closing the distance between them until they were nose to chin. He inched back a little

She closed the gap again. Then hugged him.

He would say he was getting used to it by now. He’d been hugged a lot over his unfortunately long career as a side show attraction. Unlike all the other ones this wasn’t actually some sort of death grip and he felt he could actually break out of it. Though oddly enough he didn’t want to.

132332222222221111.content:
Star couldn't believe it, well she could and knew it was an inevitable action, but why now? The second Marco tried to rub the 'paint' and failed, her whole world dropped to fear. It took everything she could to not freak out 'too much' when giving her guide/friend a good enough summary about how weird things were going to get......

"Do you mean typical Star weird or......like....destroy the school weird?" With only a beat lost, Star belted out the best awsner she could give. "Destroy the school." "Yeah, that's what i was afraid of.." The rest of Marco's words were lost on his friend as he led her along. Within her mind, Star was freaking out. Even now just looking at Marco was enough to stir up urges, horrible, unlike her urges about this....boy....Star shook her head as she tried to keep calm. "Try to relax....try not too look at the boooys..." An eerie grin came to Star's face as her eyes saw boys all around her. Tough boys, weak boys, boys walking and standing at lockers, opening them with thier boy hands. Every second of thought brought another heart to the magical girl's face, drifting to her thoughts of what to do with them starting with her friends...friends...boys who were friends.....

Marco looked back to where Star should have been and found beside a drinking fountain eyeing a guys having his fill. With a quick step of worry, Marco rushed to his friend and pulled the dazed girl away. Star's eyes quickly cleared up, a sure sign the girl was snapped back into reality. As they two leaned away, Star's arm shot out into a purple strand hitting a nearby locker. The surprised duo could only scream in surprise and fear over the 'destroy the school' level weirdness showed itself. In the midst of his screaming, Marco realized his hand was stuck to the strand itself and tried to pull it off. As Star tried to free herself from the locker, Marco heard the light tearing indocating his efforts of freedom were rewarded. The boy looked to hand and saw residue of the sticky purple substance was on his hand and attempted to get it off.
"Ugggh.." Star grunted as she pulled once more, hoping the webbing would rip so she could get away from all these boys. Star heard a moaning sound coming from Marco and looked to see him rubbing head. "Something up boo...ugghh...Marco?" "Yeah, Star. I just feel a little light headed all of a sudden...." Star gulped silently in fear, fear which became worse when she realized he was rubbing his head with a hand coated in her webbing. Marco opened his eyes, the small purple hearts replacing his eyes not helping the fear Star was feeling at all. "Ya know Star...." Marco said as his hand grabbed his friends free arm, "....why have I never told you how gorgeous you look?" "No...nonononono..." It was happening already, the webbing was affecting his mind. Slowly falling for her, it wouldn't stop until.....until...the really weird. Star could feel the hearts popping up faster and faster on her body, Marco inching closer and closer. Star looked to the covered hand, it was only a small bit, maybe the effects weren't permanent yet and could be brushed off. Oh but it was get so hard to think.....

133111.content:
Gwen grunted in anger as she sat down in the shade of the tree and continued reading her book.

Her cousin wasn't in a particularly good moode that much was clear. It was obvious he didn't really want to go on this road trip with her any more than she with him. Of course being a girl she hid her disipointment inside while he being an immature little boy made his irritation public. So being the bigger of the two she left him to stew and went somewhat deep into the wood they were parked in until Grandpa called for her.

She had started to read but something was still distracting her. A whistling sound like something falling out of the sky.

She stood up and twirled around to shout "Very funny dweeb!" Only to become silent when she saw she was yelling at thin air.

As the whistling grew louder a sudden chill raced up her spine. If Ben wasn't here making that sound.......then.

She looked skyward, and froze.

A large fireball was quickly filling up the sky. Racing for her at what must be a thousand miles an hour.

Like a rabbit and most other humans her first instinct was to stand still and stare at the pretty light. Before the more rational part of her bring argued that watching the large flaming ball of death may sting a little and smartly ran out of the way.

She managed to get a considerable distance between her and the metaphorical big red x were she'd been standing before the meteorite struck leveling that spot as well as a twenty foot radius around it. Gwen was still knocked off her feet and sent face first into the forest floor, fortunatly freshly fallen pine needles cushioned her fall and she was able to get up with only a mild disorientation and a slight ringing in her ear.

She made her way towards the crash sight. Curiousity in a situation like this always won out against common sense which said going near a burning and possibly radioactive hunk of space rock might not be the best idea. She slide down the impressive crater and landed near the rock, which up close looked far to rounded to actually be a rock at all.

"What the heck is this thing? It's not even hot." She wondered aloud. Despite being on fire a second ago the air in the crater was freezing, and stranger still the metal sphere that she thought a meteorite was still glowing but not the red got it should be.

Subconciously she raised a hand and reached foward to touch it. However inchs before she did so the sphere suddenly opened up revealing it to be a box or chest of some sort.

A bright green glow emanated from inside and for a second she thought it was radiation, but it died away quickly allowing Gwen to see inside.

It looked like a watch, a big, gaudy, butt ugly watch that no one but the flashiest of boys would wear. Though considering where it had came from she could hazard that it wasn't a watch.

She reached in closer to get a better look, going to grab it.

The last thing she expected was for it to reach out and grab her. Faster than she could blink it had jumped at her wrist and latched on, moving like liquid and tightening until only cutting her arm off could remove it.

Not that she knew that. Her first instict was to grab at it and pull it off. Her small fingers working at the watch trying to pry it loose with no success. She grabed everywhere on it, including the watchface.

There was a green flash

133231111.content:
Later, a livid Clover, dressed in her civilian though trendy attire, was stomping through the Beverly Hills Mall.

"Gah! How could they fire me?! After all I've done? After all I've been through?" Clover scowled to herself. "I mean seriously, what's wrong with a girl being fat?" her angry mutterings drawing attention to herself. "Oh please, you've never seen a fat girl before?"

Clover then headed directly to the mall's food court. She was craving something greasy. A fried chicken stand caught the mad girl's gaze. Clover promptly got in land unabashed by any judgmental eyes, impatiently waiting to place her order.

"Welcome to Beverly chicken, how can I take your order?" asked the cashier.

"Yes, I'll take a bucket of chicken, 4 biscuits, a carton of gravy, a side of slaw, and an extra large soda." Clover ordered void of any hesistance.

Despite Clover's size, the order was impressive, not many people can consume such a filling order.

Clover quickly received her order "Yeah thanks." she said, her words lacked sincere appreciation, moreso out of customary.

Clover than got herself a seat, plopping her wide buttocks soundly in the chair. Clover than set her eyes on the meal. Unimpeded, Clover tore into the fried chicken. It was unapolegetically greasy, smearing the teen's lips and fingers. After rapidly devouring four pieces, Clover turned to the biscuits, deeply dipping them in the smothering gravy. Clover then shoved the gravy laden biscuits down her impatient maw. Eight more pieces of chicken were eaten next before Clover shoveled slaw down her throat, tapping it off with a hearty chug of soda.

"Whew! That was delicious!" Clover exhaling while placing her licked clean hands on her belly. "Man I never got to eat like that before."

Clover than reflected on her decision to stay fat. When she was skinny she had placed too much energy on being thin and avoiding tasty foods. Obsessing over the size of her clothes, declining cute outfits, like that hat. Being thin made her feel small, something she didn't realize until getting fat. Being that large made her feel more confident and able to push aside anything that got in her way. She always felt more glamorous than others and being heavier made it more real. Especially compared to her teammates. Seeing Sam and Alex smaller than herself bolstered her ego. Being fat really did make her feel like the leader.

But Whoop wouldn't allow it and fired her. Clover went through so much for Whoop, putting up with so much from those missions. And now that she actually enjoyed an effect of a mission, they go and fire her.

"Unacceptable." Clover muttered. "I'll get them. I'll make them regret letting me go."

GROWL

Despite filling her stomach with greasy foods, Clover's belly quaked for more.

"But I guess revenge can wait a bit. Girl's gotta eat ya know." Clover smiled finally able to eat the things she always fantasized about.
133231111.title: Clover: Fed and Fired

133231112.content:
Several hours after Clover was fired. Whoop kindly returned her home as a parting gesture, The door was locked.
"Hey Mom, It's me Clover! Can you like unlock the door!" She kindly yelled wiping away some sweat from her forehead.
While waiting, she realised her mom doesn't know about her very sudden weight gain and worried about how she might react.
"Oh man.. How am I gonna explain this?" She wondered shaking her belly fat. Then, thoughts of the passion patties she had indulged on earlier came into her mind. "That's it!" Clover pulled out a passion patty from a box she had stolen while back at Whoop. "Oh cookies where have you been all my life!?"
While lost in her own mind, Clover's mother came to the door.
"Sorry Honey, I was just busy out in the AHHH!!!" She froze in shock, as Clover stood there with a shy smile on her face.
"Hey mom..." she said quietly.
"Clover... Is that.. is that You!? What happened to my little angel!? She asked not comprehending just how her daughter doubled in weight.
"Mom... it's okay, What happened to me was a good thing! Here!..." Clover responds by pulling out a cookie.
Clover's Mother looked at the cookie Clover held out and watched her fat arm jiggle in the process.
"These cookies did this to you? But how? You were thin yesterday how is this possible?" She asks trying to understand.
"Mom these are Passion Patties, they will make you feel really at peace with yourself! Sure you'll gain a little weight like me
But you know what? I LOVE being fat. It is the greatest thing to ever happen to me, here try one!"
Clover forcefully shoved it into her mothers mouth out of fear of being rejected. Before her mother could even respond the cookie touched her tastebuds and her eyes lit up and her body shook all over from the adrenaline of the addiction setting in.
After a few seconds her mom regathered her thoughts coming down from her 'sugargasm'.
"Clover... Please come inside and tell me more about these cookies and where we can get them!"
Clover, for the first time since being fired gave a big smile making her way in with her mother pulling by her forearm.

Back at Woohp, Jerry and the girls were still going over what had happened.
"I just don't get it... Clover would never say anything like that it's just not like her at all." Alex said pouting.
"Hmm..Well maybe Clover did, Maybe she actually is happy with being a larger woman, a BBW if you will." Jerry said looking for the simple explination.
"No that can't be it! When we were back at the factory she ditched us for cookies, then later barely helped us fight the employees..."
It's like something changed in her mind, I watched her attitude change the more she ate them." Sam added as if she was on to something.
"Perhaps there was something in the formula that did more than just make us fat. But why wasn't I effected?... I could not wait to take the cure and get rid of all that fat." Jerry replied.

Later that night Dr. Bittersweet lay in her cell, also reflecting over the last 24 hours. She was furious over being caught and that Woohp used her own formula against her.
"They will all pay, all of them. Little do they know, that my cookies contained small amounts of mind control!
If only i had waited longer i could have made the doses stronger and I wouldn't be in this mess!" She claimed slamming her hand down.
"I just hope there were a few left uncured...then i could break out of here and seek my ultimate revenge!."
With in minutes a guard approached the doctor. "Hey you fat-ass! You have a visitor." he said carelessly.
"What? Who?" the doctor asked curiously.
"Hello Doctor Bittersweet, remember me?" In walked Clover, looking a little fatter than earlier she was Determined to get answers.
"What!? It's you! Haven't you done Enough!?" The doctor yelled.
" No it's not like that... I need to talk to you, see look I'm still fat, i never took the cure." Clover showed her body as she stood closer.
A lightbulb went over Inga's head.
"Maybe she will be the one!" Inga thought.
"Please go on..."
"Well, Your cookies are the greatest thing to ever happen to me, I never knew just how wonderful it is being fat, I am for once at peace with my life and my body and it's all thanks to you. I will do anything for you Doctor because like your my hero. I just didn't realise it yesterday because of my friends. They kept me on the mission and like i was just doing my job... But then they fired me anyway!" Clover confessed.
"I have a proposition for you, my dear." Inga responded.
"What is that?" Clover asked curiously as she grabbed at some of her fat, Still intimidated by the doctor.
"Become MY spy and together we will be unstoppable! You can have all the cookies you want as pay. But first You need to break me out! What do you say? We both get our revenge and will be able to move on once we settle the score!" Inga stated very convincingly.
"Yes! Yes i will do it! I will help you doctor!" Clover tried not to shout from excitement almost getting the attention of the guards.
"Excellent! Now i need you to break me out of here. Find others who are still hooked on my cookies and we can build my empire once again!"
Inga said with a maniacal smile.

13323121.content:
"Beware that, when fighting monsters, you yourself do not become a monster...for when you gaze long into the abyss, the abyss gazes also into you."

-Friedrich Nietzsche, German philosopher

They say that everything doesn't come without a price to pay. For the blonde female Spy from WOOHP known as Clover, that price came in the form of losing her physical human appearance. To elaborate, Clover and her two friends/fellow Spies, Sam and Alex, were sent out on a mission to locate a missing cruise liner full of passengers and crew, and find out what made them disappear in the first place.

What the trio uncovered was a secret plot to transform the crew and passengers into Human-Animal hybrids, then turn them into fur coats for commercial use, and all of this was concocted by Helga Von Guggen, a fashion designer. Unfortunately, Clover was injected with the serum as well, progressively changing her into a Human-Cat hybrid. However, although they did put a grinding halt to Helga's sadistic scheme, the antidote that Sam and Alex used to change Helga and Trode's animalistic victims back to being human once more, the serum was....ineffective in reverting Clover back into her original form.

-----------------------------
WOOHP Headquarters

2 & a half weeks after the
events in "Wild Style"
-----------------------------

Within the highly-guarded interior of WOOHP Headquarters, Jerry was reviewing the accumulated data gathered from the WOOHP scientists performing numerous examinations on the Human-Feline hybrid known as Clover. Shortly after the mission was completed with success, he, Sam, and Alex quickly became of Clover still sporting fur, claws, and various other feline physical features, especially since the blonde Spy was very upset that she was still stuck as a cat-girl. From the aging man's perspective, what had transpired during that mission weighed a good deal on Jerry's subconscious, despite not having any hand in Clover's inhuman transformation other than sending her, Sam, and Alex out there to investigate.

However, while he thoroughly searched through the data results the scientists received from examining Clover, Jerry was waiting for Sam and Alex to arrive. After all, like him, the two Spies felt guilty about being unable to prevent Clover from turning into what she has now become; an inhuman freak, a creature that could exist only in fiction, treading a fragile line between man....and beast.

And speaking of the ginger-haired and raven-haired agents from WOOHP, Sam and Alex managed to arrive at WOOHP HQ. Though, unlike the usual method that they unintentionally use to get to WOOHP, the two Spies were given an escort to the organization's base of operations, due to their reconciliation over a friend who could no longer be fully human anymore. Besides the two girls became more concerned for Clover's overall well-being by the minute. The whole 2 and a half weeks waiting for results was like a knife to the gut that was still twisting little by little.

"So, Jerry; Is there, um.....is there anyway to, you know, cure Clover?" Alex asked, leaning forward on the couch she and Sam were sitting in, crouched in a hunched position as if she was bored or tired, unable to stop worrying about the transformed Clover. Though one couldn't blame her for feeling so restless. After all, she and Sam were very concerned about their blonde-haired friend's afflicted condition. So, in response to Alex's question, Jerry rubbed the bridge of his nose for a moment or two, then stood up from his chair looking at the two Spies with a grim tone and answered......
13323121.title: No Longer Fully Human

13323122.content: Alex never loses the muscle (episode: the increbible bulk)
13323122.title: Alex hulk

choices: Jerry has something that will help a little
133231221.content:
"How *long* till im back *to* *nor*mal?" The really ripped version of Alex asked through a strained and rough voice. She had eaten the 'bulky' bars in order to fight those muscle bound freaks and their equally muscluar creator Wernerstien. Sure she'd beaten him easy enough but their was a slight problem.

Apparently according to the crazed ex-mr universe the bars were 'not' meant for female consumption. Needless to say when the the guy lost all their chemically induced mass Alex was left with a six pack, and bicep and leg muscles the size of potatoes. If she stayed calm that is. For some reason if any adrenaline wentr through her system she'd revert into the walking wall she was in the castle.

"Oh I don't know. A couple weeks mabye." Sam said withnervous look hid by a smirk. Her friends looked like they were enjoying her situation way to much. They also looked like they were hiding something.

"WHAT!" She shouted in anger. Her body already responding as her muscles began to swell up once more.

"Hey Alex" Called over a masculine voice. She deflated back to the six pack look as she saw her completly reverted boyfriend walk over to her.

"I wanted to thank you for helping me out back their." He said as Alex place a muscular arm on his shoulder.

"Thanks." She said on a dreamy voice. "So you wwant to go out later mabye."

He now sported a nervous grin as he back away in a warding gesture. "Yeah look. I'm not really into dating girl's who are more ripped than I am. So uh Bye." He said and broke into a run back to the jet.

"Alex looked confused for a second before her muscles exploded in size from anger.

"More ripped. *More* *RIPPED*." She growled in anger as she continued to grow. She felt her best friends grab her enormous arms.

"Easy their beefcake. Youll probably never see him again." Said Sam.

Her biceps began to shrink.

"Yeah your so buff that you won't need to go to the gym for the rest of the year."

Her arms balloned again as she struggled against her two best friends who though having smiles were actually pulling her back as hard as they could. Fortunatly they were saved by Jerry who was coming over for the traditional pat on the back.

"Girls well done. Youve saved the world from foul play and the threat of rampaging bpdy builders."

"Thank's Jer. Wish more missions were like this one." Said Clover in a dreamy voice.

Jerry nodded before turning back to Alex. "And Alex I see your taking the bad news rather well."

"Yeah well it's only a few weeks like this right. It's not that bad."

Behind her the girls were making warding signs at Jerry he missed.

"A few weeks. Oh I see the girl's forgot to tell you that your condition is permanent." He said as a mnatter of factly.

"WHAT!!!" She growled in rage as she assumed once again her full giant muscled form. Jerry had turned away with his eye's closed and his hand under his chin as he often does when speaking for some reason.

"The test's show an irreversable change in your body due to eating those bar's which were according to Wernerstein because they were 'not' meant for female consumption. Which is also the reason why your mass is fluctuating with your mental state. Something to do with the female hormones and adrenaline."

She was glaring at her two 'tiny' friends.

"I'm sorry Alex but the data say's that no matter what you do, no matter what you eat or how liitle you excercise will never be any less fit and muscular than in the calm state you are in now." He turned to see the girls expression and his eyes widened in surprise as she saw a huge version of Alex chasing her two best friend's into the distance.

"Mmm not the worst reaction I've ever seen from an agent getting bad new's." He said plainly as he turned to enter the jet.
133231221.title: Forever bulk

1332312211.content:
The trio was back at Woohp headquarters sitting on the expensive english couch that they always landed on then they were 'woohped' while Jerry was sitting behind his desk while still wearing their mission cloths. Over head was the computer that ran the entire complex the 'Gadget Lending And Distributing Interactive System' or g.l.a.d.i.s as she likes to be called.

Alex was midway between her minimal muscular form and her she hulk impersonation. She was staring straight ahead at Jerry instead of looking at her two friends. She wasn't that angry anymore after she'd worked it off at them but she was still pretty upset that she had too find it out from Jerry and not them.

Next to her were her two best friends who had seen much better day's. They hadn't been savagly beaten fortunatly. They didn't have any major bruises or injury's but Alex had chased them to the point of exhaustion were they promptly collapsed only to find themselves on this very couch moments ago.

Across from then Jerry coughed into his fist and tried to work up some courage to speak without provoking the amazon in front of him. When she had been done with the girls she'd brought them both back to the jet with one under each arm. When he'd asked if they were all right her response was to kick him into Wernerstein's fountain.

"Okay then girl's. As I said earlier on her own there is absolutly no chance of the changes on Alex to revert on their own. Nor will lack of excercise or a horrible diet do anything to change your currant state of health."

"Grrrr." Said Alex as their was a noticable bulge in her muscle again.

Sam smiled a little straining her tired face. "Well on the plus side you can eat whatever you want and never have to worry about getting fat." 'Not that you couldn't do that before.' Thought the smartest of the three jealously.

The fact her other best friend didn't shrink told Sam that Alex knew that too.

Clover yawned and rubbed her eye a little. "So what's the big new's Jer. You wouldn't just bing us back here just to do a recap on the bad new's."

Jerry nodded before a mechanical hand brought moved out of the wall holding an injection gun with a capsule full of clear green liquid.

"While we can't completly remove the muscle we can stop your fluctuating mass problem." Jerry said.

"Huh." Said the brawny girl. She shrunk a little as her confusion overroad her anger.

"We can stop you from getting more and less muscular based on your emotional state. You'll also be able to control your emotions as well as you could before your change."

Alex smiled and leaned foward in her seat. " Well what are we waiting for. The sooner I don't have to be a moving mountain the better."

The look on Jerry's face told her he also had some bad news.

"Actually Alex. This chemical will cause you to remain that 'moving mountain' as you call it." Jerry said sadly.

Alex and the girls eye's widened in surprise.

"W-what." She said.

Jerry's sad look only frew grimer. "I'm sorry Alex but as much as we tried for some blasted reason we couldn't get the formula to stick with your minimal muscled state or any state between. The only simulation it worked in was were you are in your 'maxmum' muscle state."

"Alex can't go out looking like that. Do you know how hard it is for a girl like that to find a guy who isn't afraid she'll hurt him?" Clover said in a hush hush motion.

"Yeah isn't their another way." Said sam with her hands in her lap.

Jerry sighed. "I'm sorry girl's but this is indeed the only other option. If Alex take's this formula she will remain in her full muscled body for the rest of her life but she will be in total control of her emotions and she won't have to worry about changing size. Were as if she refuses she can still pass for normal but she will have to keep herself under control which right now is hard for her too do judging from her constant chaging since we boarded the jet."

Alex sighed but nodded. She was finding it a 'lot' harder to keep herslef in check and the smallest things would make her angry.

"So Alex whats your descision?" Asked Jerry.
1332312211.title: bad news and more bad new's

13323122111.content:
They were once again at their shared home in beautiful Beverly Hills.

Not one of the three was currently speaking to one another from the sheer tension in the house. Alex had decided she would rather be a giant for the rest of her life and be in control than a fluctuating mass of muscle that got mad enough to smash anything that annoyed her. The only effect was that she momentarily felt extreme rage to cause her to go maximum muscle before the anger was swept away but leaving her in that state. Trapping her like this for life. They'd road home in silence and had made for seperate areas in the house. Clover was in her room looking for something. Sam was watching TV trying to push the whole day out of her mind.

Alex was....

*RRRIIIPPP*

"DAMN IT!"

That was the third pair of pants she'd ruined just trying to put them on. All over her room were the remnents of clothing that 'used to' fit perfectly now she could barley get them over her huge calves. Her tops were the same. She could barley button the ones over her rock hard abs now never mind her chest and the tops she used to slip over her head always got stuck when they reached her shoulders.

She'd been reduced to wearing the cloth's she wore when she went to visit her parent's. A very big and conservative top and a loose fitting pair of jeans which hid all clues that she was a girl back when she was smaller. Now they fit her perfectly.

She sighed before turning to her full length mirror. She flexed her arm and her frown deepened when she heard her cloth's creak.

'This is a nightmare' She thought. She was a seven foot tall teenage girl with more muscle and strength than even a mister universe possessed if how easily she beat Wernerstien was anything to go by. She could just imagine how her dating life was going to be now.

In her head she imagined she was in the hallway at Beverly Hills high. She came up behind a boy she liked and tapped his shoulder. He'd turn around and she'd ask "Hey you wanna go out this saturday." Then he'd fall to his knees crying "Please don't hurt me."

Then there was Mandy. Their was no way whatsoever that she'd be able to even walk in the door without the purple wearing witch making fun of her with names to numerous to mention.

She'd have to treat the world like it's made of glass. She'd opened the door to the house and it'd broken right off the hinge's. She'd tried to pour some juice earlier and every time she tried she broke the glass between her finger's.

The only plus she could see was that the gym coach would probably worship the ground she walked on since soccer and gym would be a snap now. No doubt that part of her in her life would be good but the rest looked like it was going to suck.

"Hey Alex." Called Clover from the doorway.

"Don't you know you should knock before coming into a person's room?" Said the girl as she continued to look sadly at her reflection.

"I thought that only counted if the door was still attached to the doorway?" Said the blonde as she pointed to the door laying against a wall.

Alex groaned and looked at one of her two best friends.

"What is it Clover?"

"Okay hear it is. What do I do to make myself feel better when I'm depressed?" She said happily.

"Pick a boy at random from your little black book to take you out then dump him three hours later?" Said Alex in her usual way.

Clover's eyebrow twitched a little but her smile stayed on.

"No. I go SHOPPING!" She said loudly as she whipped out a handfull of credit card's and spread them like a fan.

"I don't know Clover I don't think that I should go out like this." Alex said apprehensivly.

"Oh so you'll go out when your normal again. Okay that should only take, gee I don't know, NEVER!" She got in her friends face. "Look Alex I know you don't want to face it but sooner or later your going to have to leave this house and it might as well be doing something you like to do."

"But I..." Alex started half heartedly.

"No but's Ms Muscles. Unless you plan to wear that ugly top for the rest of your life you need new cloth's. Now grab your card's and let's go!." Said the blonde with a tone of finality.

Alex looke at the torn cloth's littered about her room. "Well I guess I do need new stuff."

Clover smiled and made for the door. "Perfect. See you downstairs in five minutes."

Alex sighed before smiling a little. 'Thanks Clover' She thought before she moved to grab her own card filled wallet.
13323122111.title: Alex's thinks about her new life

133231221111.content:
The mall was exactly as they expected it to be.

As they walked through it the group was the centre of attention. Or rather Alex was the centre of attention. Since getting here all she'd gotten were blatent stare's and not so hushed whisper's. On either side of her Sam and Clover were shooting angry glares at the gaping crwod who seemed to wilt as soon as they looked at them.

Noticing Alex's stopped walk as a sign of depression Clover smiled reassurinly and spoke. "Relax Alex. It's Beverly hill's, just give them a week and you 'know' they'll find something 'else' to stare at."

Alex just raised her head slightly. "Do you think in a week's time can turn into 'right now?'"

Her friend's moaned slightly at the lack of progress they were making with her when they spotted their favourite cloth's shop. They grabbed a hand each and somehow managed to drag thier muscular friend into the store.

They set to work immediatly. Well morso Clover than Sam. They dashed about the store like hyperactive blur's. Grabbing whatever they thought would look good on their giant friend who they'd shoved into a changing room. By the end of it they'd handed in no less than thirty articles of clothing to Alex. They were both pleased with themselves for the moment until the girl's response came from the room.

"None of this stuff fit's."

Clover replyied. "Huh? Are you sure? I mean all that stuff is 'large'."

An annoyed voice shot back at her. "Well this 'Large' blouse feel's like a 'small'. It's barley any better than the stuff I had at home. And their was some really cute stuff in here I liked "

"Don't worry Alex jusrt hand us out the stuff you like and well just ask the manager to get you the next size up."

The two girl's searched the store for a few second's before finding the manageress.

"Um excuse me." Said Sam.

The woman turned. She looked a few yars older than then and had a slight air of a snob about her.

"Yes how can I help you today?" She said in a voice that people stereotypically associate with wealth.

Sam smiled a little before lifting up the cloth's that Alex said she liked. "We were wondering if you could get us the next size up for these cloth's?"

The woman looked over the cloth's for a second, examining the tags before he raised her hand to her mouth and started laughing. "Are you serious. These are the biggest size we have. What are you trying to dress a bull elephant?"

Both girl's glared at the woman who continued to laugh. Clover turned back to the dressing room and shouted a little." Hey Alex could you come out here for a sec?"

The door opened and out came the muscular girl dressed as she was when she came in. She walked over to the girl's and the woman who was now coughing rather badly as soon as she saw Alex.

"What is it Clover?"

The blonde smiled before turning back to the manageress and hid her malicousness behind a happy smile. "Tell her what you just told us a second ago."

The woman nearly fainted as Alex fixed her sight on her. All semblance of her superiority over the cusomer she usually had was gone as she tried to stammer out a response.

"We we we d-d-don't have a bi-big-bigger size of the cl-cloth's you asked for." Her fear grew as the girl zoomed in to meet her face.

Alex looked distressed. "What! But I really like these cloth's."

"So-sorry bu-but the only pla-pl-place that you c-c-c-could go would be the bi-big and t-t-tall store across for here." She stammered out. As soon as she mentioned the 'big and tall' Alex's brow went into a frown and she promptly fainted.

Clover and Sam grinned at each other fo a moment before their friend turned around. Her face once again slack from depression.

"The big and tall? That's were I have to shop now? Being like this really stink's, I bet they don't even have any cute stuff." She found her friends taking either side of her as they once again pulled her out of her formally favourite store.

"Relax. I'm sure that they have some really good stuff in here too." Said Clover trying to cheer her friend up.

Alex just sighed and let her friend's drag her into the store were the two found themsselves to be the smallest one's there.
133231221111.title: From medium to XL

1332312211111.content:
"Now that's more like it." Said the huge girl happily as she flexed her massive biceps to test her new cloth's.

Despite her initial fear 'the big and tall' turned out to be an all right place. They really did have a good selection of cute cloth's rather than the bland or just plain manish stuff she'd been expecting/ Not to mention that the other customer's were more her size if not 'taller' which made her feel more normal again.

It was also kinda funny to se Sam and Clover feel like midget's in comparison.

So now she was testing out her new cloth's that she'd bought and was pleased that they did not strain or tear when she moved.

"Told you it wouldn't be so bad. Theyre were even some cute boy's you got to talk to" Said Clover once again standing in the to be fixed doorway with her arm's crossed.

"Those were bodybuilder's. They asked me about my routine to get my abs so ripped." The girl sighed. She'd been talked to a couple of grade A hunk's in the store today, but it turned out that they were only interested in how she got so big before walking off with a pair of girl's who were 5'5 and curvy. Unlike her

So now even if she finds a guy who's not intimidated by her the chances of her actually being attractive to him are slim since she was about as curvy as the incredible hulk.

"Hey at least they talked to you." The blonde said in a good natured fashion only to be silenced by a glare. "Look on the bright side you'll have plenty more chances tommorrow at school."

Alex's eye's bugged out. "School? I can't go to school looking like this." She made herpoint by flexing causing the football sized bicep to jut out.

Clover groaned before giving the girl a heated look. "Didn't we have this talk a while ago. You 'need' to accept your stuck like this and get on with your life or else you'll totally end up a loner."

The bigger girl tried to come up with an arguement.

"But they..."

"Of course they'll stare Alex. Just give them a while and and make something up when they ask how it happened and they'll treat you like they alway's have."

"What about...."

"Well duh. Mandy take's crack's at us whenever possible. You being muscular won't make her act any more like the evil queen she already is."

"What if...."

"You just need to control yo strength soyou don't hurt anyone. Besides you did say that coach would worship the ground you walk on when he see's this."

She tried to come up with a good arguement. She really did but Clover had shot down anything she was about to say even before she'd said it. So she just lowered her head in an obvious sign of defeat.

Clover smirke before going to leave the room. "See you tommorrow for school." Then she left

Alex just stared at the floor for a few second's in deep thought. The mall was bad enough.

High school on the other hand? She'd be eaten alive.
