133331211111211112.content:
Putting his shirt back on after his morning 'taking his shirt off and dumping a bucket of water over his head in the yard for no reason' routine he dried off with a nearby towel before heading over to the Test house to tell the youngest Test the sick news he'd just heard.

Hopping over the fence rather than simply walk the two feet around it he headed up to the door and gave it three sharp knocks before shifting into a cross armed 'too cool' pose.

Their was a clattering inside. Some familiar dudes voice yelled out "No!" for some reason before a blonde with red highlights opened the door.....just....not the blonde with red highlights he'd thought it would be

The blonde heart throb's jaw fell open. The ridiculously hot girl standing in the doorway mirroring him.

"Gil?!" She blurted out before correcting herself "I mean..hey boy I've never met before."

For once in his life, Gil Nexdor was utterly speechless in the presence of a girl "H-hey Uh. I...uh.girl....who?"

"Johnni Test." She lied. Remembering to say the first to letters of her name as 'joe' instead of 'jaw' after only 30 tries. Now for the backstory she'd finally remembered "Johnny's....cousin.....from Canada.....ay."

Almost remembered. It was meant to be California.

It was hardly the greatest lie ever told, but with how Gil was just staring at her without blinking and nodding along she realized she could have told him she was the rabbit eared cookie empress of the frog men of Neptune and she would have gotten the same response.

She blushed from embarrassment when it caught up to her that the boy was 'staring' at her. Looking her up and down a few times in the way all guys did with hot girls without realizing before catching himself.

"Cool." He smiled the smile that always made her now younger sisters melt "I..uh...was looking for Johnny-brah. I know he's dying to tear up that new skate park next week, and I won two tickets to shred up the pace before anyone else does 'today'."

"Oohhh." Crud! Johnny had been dreaming of that place for months, ever since he..she heard they were pulling in an eighty foot ramp! The youngest Test had been pacing a hole in his floor waiting, and now Gil comes along saying he could get in early?! Seriously!?

"Sssorry.But Johnny can't go to the park." The word hurt to drag out "Johnny ah, were on aaaaa cousin exchange right now. His folks wanted him up north to get some 'mounty discipline', and I wanted to visit my down south family while they had the spare room. Long story short he's gonna be gone and I'm gonna be here instead for a while........ay."

"Awesome!" The blonde said with a smile...before he developed a sudden interest in the sky "I mean, bogus. Guess I'll have to christen the park in his honor."

"Gil!...why don't...I go with you."

He paused "You skate?"

She cocked her hip and put a fist on it. Reaching behind the door for her trusty ride "Did Tony Hawk's last game crash and burn?"

Gil stared at the blonde babe who he just found out is a board jockette.

"I love you."

Though because he blurted it out she didn't quite catch it "What?"

"I said lets go."

"Great. Last one to the park has to get jumped over." She smiled before jumping out the door. Landing on her board as she races down the path and onto the sidewalk

"Wha? Hey wait up!"

Susan's teeth ground together loudly at the sight or her new older sister and long time crush board out of sight through the magic of close circuit camera.

"First you take my beauty. Now you think you can just take MY Gil. Your crossing the line 'Johnny'." She growled out. Before coughing violently. Grasping the nearby table to keep herself steady. Her knees buckled under her and she almost went to her knees before catching herself.

"The flakes turn you into a Gil stealing hottie, while it makes me sick? Your so gonna get it Johny." She growled out as she stood up. Walking back over to continue to experiment not noticing or ignoring the marks in the solid wood surface she'd grabbed onto now having four holes in it, like someone had tried driving nails into it

13411121.content:
"Do you see him yet Aisha?" Asked a girl dressed in a red top, red silk pants, head scarf and veil.

Across from her a near identical girl in a pink version of her outfit turned away from looking out the window and shook her head.

"No Leila. Mabye he's not coming around today." She said sadly. Next to her yet another similiarly dressed, simialiar bodied girl disagreed.

"He coming alright. This is the direction the guards chase him every day." Said the one called Kaylee.

Next to princess Jasmine (whose beauty brought suitors from far and wide) these three sisters where he most saught after women in all of Agrabah. There were a number of reasons for this, aside from there obvious looks. Despite their incredible beauty they were considered a mere close second to the breath taking loveliness of the princess. They compensated for this by having much more curvacious bodies than her. Though that wasn't to say their weren't other reasons.

For starters despite dressing like Harem girls Aisha, Leila and Kaylee where in fact the triplet daughters of the most successful caravan trader in Agrabah. A man whose wealth came close to the level of royalty. Allowing them to live in the lap of luxury, which could be said for any suitors they might take a shine to.

this meant the one they chose to marry would become the heir apparent to their father Yasir's. Inheriting a large portion of his fortune and taking over his buiness when the marriage was finalized.

Now you'll notice I said 'the one ''they'' chose to marry'. This brings us to the third and greatest reason these girls had suitors lining up around Agrabah. They simply didn't want to be seperated when they married. Growing up constantly at each others side made them somewhat 'reluctant' to be part, so in his infinite wisdom Yasir came up with a rather simple solution to this girl's dileema.

The three girl's would all marry one boy.

It was not unheard of. In fact they knew one or two girls who had married polygamously. However the idea of marrying all three beauties may have brought men to the door. It was also what kept them from marrying.

If one sister did not like the suitor then all three rejected him. It was either they all liked him. Or none of them did.

So suitors came and went. Yasir growing increasingly worried that he would have to start bringing in men from out of Agrabah because they were starting to rn out of unrejected men in the city.

That's when they saw him.

It was out at market one day, they had been eyeing a few of the stalls when a boy caught there eye from the tarp above a food stall. He intrigued them with his cunning in stealing from the vendor without getting caught. He made them giggle at his antics as well as at his monkey, he amazed them with his deftifying acrobatic feats when he was spotted by the guards and he outran them with as much agility as his pet. Finally when he turned and he saw his face he made them swoon at how handsome he was.

This was the man they wanted.

They told their father. He was a little weary that a 'street rat' had caught his precious girl's eye's. Though he supposed that them agreeing on a suitor again wouldn't happen in his lifetime so he relented. As long as he was healthy 'and' the girls could get him themselves then he had no problem with this boy. The guard's wouldn't exactly hand him over in one piece iif they found him and his mmerchants weren't being paid to track down one man.

Kaylee was the first to notice he always passed by their home when running from the guards. Which happened every day in what Aladdin considered sport. Each time a little differant, guards would useually be blocking the road since the routing had become predictable so the young thief always had to escape differantly. Sometimes even jumping through house windows. They just had to be patient and leave the wooden shutters open so he'd jump in.

Then he'd be there's.

"You girl's are wasting your time with that street rat!" Came a gruff reply from their rather stout housekeeper. "If it was me I'd turn him over to the guards." She turned and left with disgust evident on her face.

'good thing were not you.' They thought as one.

Aisha continued her surveying the street. Not much here. Some carts, a shepherd herding sheep, rigging for a new bui...."THERE!" She cried to her sisters.

The other two crowded round the window. They saw a handsome young man effortlessly climbing the rigging, one hand clutched around a loaf of bread.

Again they were amazed by his ability's. It wasn't just anybody who could make the guards look foolish.

That was when they saw it, as the guards started shaking the rigging he lept over...towards 'their' window.

"Quick, act normal." Said Leila before they moved away from the window and took phony stances to look occupied.

There hearts leapt as they met Aladdin face to face. In there home.

"Hello ladies." He said right as a monkey landed on his shoulder.

They swooned a little. There happiness was short lived as he made for the other window in the room.

Kayla's hand shot out. "Wait." She said.

The boy turned to face her. Just as they heard a mass number of footsteps running up the houses stairs. The guards saw him and were coming in.

With no thought behind her actions Kayla pulled him back from the window and threw him into the large pile of pillows in the corner, her sisters covering him then sitting down causing him to go "Oomph."

Three guards burst through the door. Scimitars poised to do some serious cutting up.

The head guard turned to the girl's. Rage vanished in the face of the ravishing young women, who he recognised as the 'very powerful and influential' merchant Yasir's infamous daughter's.

"Pardon me my ladies. But did a 'street rat' come through here?" He said in forced sincerity.

Kayla nodded with her nose upturned before pointing out the window. "That 'filthy' vermin jumped in here and tried to 'do things' to us. After him."

Raul's eye's widened in surprise "Are you alright?"

"Fine. Just. GET. HIM!" She screamed.

The guards couldn't get out fast enough.

Aisha and Leila both reached in to the pillows and pulled the boy and his monkey out. He smiled thankfully at the three before turning back to the window he entered.

"Thanks for the assist girl's. I'll remember it." He put his hand on the window frame but was once more pulled back by Kayla.

"Hold on."

He turned back. A little uncomfortable at how they were looking at him.

"We saved your life right?" Said Kayla.

"That mean's you owe us." Aisha said while giving him a sultry smile.

Aladdin smiled nervously as the girls continued to advance on him.

"Sorry girl's but I'm afraid I don't have much to give. Street rat remember?"

The girls cornered him and continued boxing him in. Abu was to busy stuffing his face with fruit to notice.

"Well there is something you could do." Said Leila who along with her sietrs were pressing right against him. The young man suppressed a low groan as he felt their combined chests rub against him. Thank the sands he was wearing baggy pants.

"Umm..wh-what would th-that b-be?" He asked.

Their looks turned predatory for a moment, before breaking out into joyous grins.

"Marry us!" They said in unison right before they all moved in to kiss him.

134111211.content:
“So you are the famous Aladdin.” Said the firm and commanding voice of Rasir, father of the triplets.

Now here was a man who looked infinity more like the sultan than the sultan. He was tall and imposing, built like a brick wall and looked like he'd really was made of granite. He wore lavish and colourful robes made of expensive materials such as silk, a symbol of his status and wealth.

Neither was he an ugly man, he was not boyishly handsome like Aladdin, if he had ever been. No this was the kind of rugged good looks that could allow a man just to point at a woman to make her his. He had aged gracefully since those days, only bearing a few wrinkle's he could do nothing about and only a few inches off his impressive height, his eyes still a piercing green bored into Aladdin's very sole.

Aladdin for his part definitely felt that as he was seated across the table from the man, pulling his imaginary collar.

“Yeah.” He said cautiously.

“I understand that despite your 'fame...” Rasir left it hanging.


The boy gulped, knowing full well what the man who could easily break him in half meant.

“...despite it my daughters appear to be very taken with you. If your face is anything to go by.” The man said dryly.

True, Aladdin's face had more lipstick on it than the girls had on their lips. A small trail leading down his neck let Rasir know the boys constraint since they stop just short of his chest.

“You realise how lucky you are boy? My daughters have turned away countless individual suitors only to all settle on a...street rat.” He said in distaste.

“Hey!!!” Barked Aladdin. He didn't care if the man was more than twice his size he wouldn't be insulted.

Rasir just laughed. Shaking whatever was not nailed down. “Settle boy, I'm just grateful that my daughters have finally decided on a suitor.” He leaned over to face Aladdin. “You 'are' planning on marrying them right.”

No its not a grammar error. That wasn't a question.

On reflex the boy would have said “no”, but he's be lying if he said he wasn't considering it, three girls, triplets no less wanted to all marry him. Not just any triplets either but Rasirs daughters. Everyone in Agrabah knew about them, who were known throughout the seven sands as the most beautiful girls for miles around. They're unattainably only added to their fame drawing in any and all single males from the farthest reaches of the unknown.

It was actually part of his day, whenever a rich noble entered Agrabah people would always bet on whether they were heading to the palace for the princess or here. He'd sit with Abu and time how long it would take for the idiot to be tossed out by the walking mountain of a father.

From what time he'd spent with the girls befre meeting their father he could tell theyre was more to them than just looks, theyre room was lined with intricate woven fabric and art that Aisha claimed to have made herself. Leila was apparetnly the smart one since her father would always ask her for help with the finances. Kaylee was the funny and athletic one if the way she could literally bend over backwards to reach an apple from the fruit bowl was any indication

(I had to flesh them out so Aladdin wouldn't seem shallow)

The fact that they wanted to marry him was unbelievable.

So when faced with that, all the street boy could utter was.

“Yes.”

This pleased the giant man. “Good. Now before you marry them I'm afraid I must press some conditions for it.

'Here we go. Thought Aladdin bitterly. He was going to give Aladdin some impossible task so he couldn't marry the three.

“Now like I did for my wife's father, which he did for his wife's father and so forth. I require you to bring me a dowry of 20 gold coins.”

“Gold? In case you haven't noticed I'm not exactly well off. Plus I only steal food”

“And you think I was n better when I was asked to do this by my father in law? No I was dirt poor but I managed it”

He saw the distress on the boys face and sighed. “Aladdin, I have never seen my girls so happy to be around a boy but this is tradition, this marriage will also make you my heir so I need to know that you can acquire money without stealing it. Understand.”

The boy slowly nodded, understanding even though he didn't like it.

“Excellent. Oh by the way, I need that money to be with me within a week.”

============================


“Where the heck am I going to earn 20 gold coins in a week.” Wondered Aladdin as he walked down the streets of Agrabah.

“Maybe I can help?” Came an old and grating voice.

Aladdin looked up to see a hunched over old man standing in his path, grey rags covering him and a beaten old stick to support him.

“I know were you can get a 'lot' of gold.” The old man grinned with a mouth full of crocked teeth.

At Aladdin's hopeful look Jafar internally sneered. He had found his diamond in the rough.

1341112111212.content:
Aladdin basked in the lustful attention of all his women. Eagerly biting at grapes being hand feed to him, enjoying the cool fanned air. Two scantily dressed beauties massaged his feet while one rubbed at knots in his neck, making sure her large breasts were pressing at the back of his head.

Outside the tent Abu found himself in a like-wise situation, Albeit one he would rather leave if he could. Pressing all around him stopping his escape was his own group of loving females. While he'd enjoy it if it were as he was before and it was a bevy of female monkies, Instead it was a group of six beautiful lady elephants pressing him from all sides. Giving him the goo goo eyes, tickling his trunk or pulling at his little tail.

This did not tickle the former monkey's fancy like the girls tickled Aladdins, and since he was now several tons of hard to move elephant instead of an agile little monkey the girls didn't have to worry about their mate gatting away.

Nor did it tickle Genie, who was busy pacing a hole to the desert floor, despite not having legs.

"Ok genie ok. Relax relax relaxrelaxrelax!" Carpet followed his rapid movements as though it had eyes. "Its no big deal. You just...poofed like 30 young women (more if you include the elephants) into flesh and blood existence for the sole purpose of loving and serving one man. Its not like it's that bad? Right?"

He looked at carpet who just shrugged his tasles.

"Oh don't give me that? It was an easy mistake. They ain't hurting nobody? Whats the worst that could happen?"

The world suddenly went dark.

"Hey who turned out the sun?"

The sound of a switch being pulled in a large hall came from nowhere and the blue Djinn was standing underneath a spotlight.

He gulped "Uh oh."

The ground rumbled and he fell back onto his now none whispy butt and in a tiny uncomfortable school chair. The darkness in front of him somehow became more solid as a large dark shape like a semi circle towered over him.

A shirt appeared on him so he could tug at the collar.

7 lights appeared behind the top of the shape, 7 lights given off by 7 glowing bodies. 7 bodies with 7 unique colours and manacles around their wrists.

Genies.

Three women and three men sat at 6 podiums reaching the middle of the massive tribunal stand. All looking down at him with a mixture of anger and sadness. In the middle a final figure rose up, one that had the blue man almost gasping for breath.

He was not the most massive of the Djinn before him, that belonged to the violet one at the far left, nor was he the most regal, that distinction belonged to the oriental magenta genie in the kimono. However what this Djinn gave off was far more dangerous, an aura of pure force that made cosmic power seem like a cheap card trick by a newbie stage magician. The genie was a brilliant gold in colour, hair braided into a ponytail that stretched down his back, on his head a band made from the metal that pounded the galaxy into shape and adorned with gems that came in as many colours as his species did.

The grand high Djinn.

Looking down on him with terrifying indifference the leader of all genies spoke in a terrifyingly dull monotone that made him soul itch.

"Do you think the rules were made to be bent?"

"Well uh, you see, your, your supreme highness what happened was...."

"NO!" A voice like a thunder clap blew him back onto his posterior. The massive Nordic look Djinn dressed in furs slammed his ham like hand on the podium "THE RULES ARE FIRM! RIGID! UNBREAKABLE AND UNYIELDING! NO LOOPHOLES!"

A female genie, one of arabian dress and cream white skin tittered behind a hand "Though blunt Onska has a point, The rules are meant to be honored in both word and spirit. As they are meant to be taken, Not how they 'can' be taken. You would not try and find away around the rule of no killing would you?"

Genie gave a long sufering sigh and wiped ran a cloth over his brow, emptiing the sweat into a nearby bucket. "C'mon! I didn't mean to do it! I just put a little to much detail into my work and it took on a life of its own. You can't tell me thats never happened before right?"

"It has" The mint green genie dressed in native American garb nodded sagely.

Genie huffed in relief.

"And we also visited punishment upon them."

That huff was sucked right back in.

This time another female spoke, a deep blue one in the style of a north born scottish woman , looking down at his with apologetic and sad eyes. "Ye cannae jus create life الجني(genie- I got it from the google translator). Such a hing is forbidden to all but tha power tha be an has far reachin' consequences not even our powers can predict. Accident or no we canae just leave ye to yer carelessness."

"Well said Guidhe." The lord spoke up, his gaze never leaving the accused "Though not the most severe of charges against him." He turned from his confused court to the accused "You do not fully comptehend just what you have done, do you?" Genie shook his head slowly, too scared to even think of correcting him. "Creating true life is not only taboo because it can be used to circumvent the rules. Because true life, unlike a construc, has another ability." He gripped his staff audibly tighter. "The ability to be granted wishes."

A lead weight suddenly dropped in genie's stomach. Guidhe gasped while Onska glared at him with teeth bared. He would have backed away, but unlike a second ago the full scope of what he did came to bare. He'd created those girls with the mindset of being in love with, and totally loyal to Aladdin. He'd certainly never meant to make them real, but they were. Which meant he'd created twenty four new potential masters who, being loyal and in love with Aladdin, the boy could easily convince them to make wishes for him, and thats if they don't decide to make those wishes for him without telling him 'out of love'.

Wishes that make Aladdin better, or improve the current girls standing with Aladdin over their 'sisters'. Make him stronger, make him richer, make him a king, an emporer, a demi-god! Make themselves Aladdins favourite, no me, I want that job! The sky was the limit....and all of them would have something to do with his current master.

Thats seventy-three extra wishes Aladdin possibly had before he used his last to free him!

Then with dread genie realised the full weight of everything. If he could create girls who could make wishes like that? What was to stopping him from creating a new master, who could wish him free?

What would stop any genie from creating a master that could wish for whatever the genie 'tells' them to wish?

The great one's gaze softened as genie'sfell to the ground. "I see now you understand the full gravity of this situation."

"Do you have anything to say before we pass punishment upon you?"

Genie stood theyre for a second. Looked around the never ending darkness, scratched his head and said "Well since your gonna stick it to me anyway....just....don't make it to messy."

The lord nodded "Such a crime, born from gnorance as it was, is not fitting of a gruesome fate, and the ten thousand years you spent locked away in the cave of wonders only to keep your humour shows that locking you away for another eon could cause no ill effect. So it is the decision of this tribunal..." He turned his gaze to all his lesser judges who nodded "...The decision of this tribunal that your nature be changed."

"Changed?" Please don't be a toaster, please don't be a toaster, please don't be a toaster.

"Indeed." The world filled with like brighter than a thousand suns, yellow lightning dancing between the genie lords fingertips before it struck the blue one "Now and forever let your true form be changed. Immutable and uncompromising. This form shall exceed all other magics and can never be undone...."

Genie felt himself warping into a new shape, except when he did that himself he could still feel his regular form at the core of his being, the central part of himself that he would become when not flexing his shape changing magic. That part of him was being over-ridden by the incredible force being unleashed on him. Changing what made him him.

As the pain subsided the darkness that filled up the oasis faded back into the light of day. A final echo of his lords voice filled his ears before all went quiet.

"Let the punishment fit the crime."

Genie wondered what he meant. Grasping at the sand beneath him he blinked away any wooziness from being zapped.

Carpet drifted over to him, clearly distressed. Then even more so when the rug seemed to take a fit at the sight of him.

"Whats got your weave in a kn...."

That wasn't his voice.

He sat up, and felt something very different about himself.

He looked down.

(All genie names were either translated as 'wish' or 'genie'. Genie's name is just 'genie' in Arabic. I thought it would be strange for genies to refer to another one of them as genie. Also I'm sorry about the Scottish or Scandinavian genies portrayal, I just wanted the Scottish one to have an accent (which I find hard to write) and the viking one to be big and tough.)

1341122221.content:
Aladdin and Jasmine watched in amazement as the Tree of Renewal which was destroyed by Mirage's magic became whole once more. This Tree, the only thing which could save them from their serpentine forms, stood healthy and strong once more.

Aladdin reached and selected two fruits for him and his love. "Here," he said with a smile. Jasmine nodded and took the fruit. Her heart raced and her body tensed.

This is it. I can become human once more! Two legs. No scales!

But Iago had a point. My new body has some advantages. I hurt Aladdin with my spines, but I still saved him with my new strength. I feel quicker than before. My senses . . . I am noticing Abu and the others even over here where Aladdin's scent is overwhelming.

It will be a shame to lose some of these things. I've come to really like this body.

She bit into the magical fruit and felt a warmth fill her. Before her eyes, she watched her love shift into human form once more. "Jasmine," he whispered.

"Yes?" Jasmine responded as she noticed something: her tongue was still snake-like! "Genie!" she called. Genie moved in and revealed a mirror. She stared at herself, human above the waist, but her long emerald scales tail dragging behind her.

"Genie! What happened?" Aladdin asked.

"II don't know Al. It should have changed her back to human," Genie said with confusion. Jasmine shook her head.

"No. I'll try another fruit, Maybe because of how much longer I was exposed . . ." Jasmine said. She turned and jumped back when the blindfolded Fasir stood there.

"No, Princess, that will not change you," he said.

"Fasir!" Aladdin called. "What happened? Is this some trick of Mirage's?"

"To a degree. The Tree of Renewal is powerful, but limited. It cannot be used to change a person back who does not wish to change," Fasir said.

"Wait . . . doesn't wish . . ." Aladdin said, turning his head to Jasmine.

She looked down in shame. "For a moment before I bit the fruit, part of me was going to miss the tail and other advantages this has," she admitted.

"Great. How stupid can ya get?" Iago yelled, before being hit by Abu.

"Her heart wanted this. A second fruit will not reverse it further," Fasir said.

"So . . . I am truly stuck like this?" Jasmine asked.

"Yes. You will not change further, but the Tree will not change you back either," Fasir said. "You are a snake-woman now." Jasmine shook her head as tears came to them. Aladdin moved close to his beloved.

"Jas," he said.

"Don't Aladdin. I don't deserve your love. I . . . I didn't want to become human. I wanted to stay a monster. How could you love me?" Jasmine asked. Aladdin hugged her and pulled her close.

"I love you for who you are, Jasmine. I love more than just your body," he replied softly. "And . . . I don't mind your body."

"You . . . You don't?" Jasmine asked. Her semi-human eyes looked into his eyes.

"No. This body saved me when I fell from the cliff and from those thieves. You saved me," Aladdin said.

"But . . . my spines," she whispered, as the long black thorns laid on her back.

"When I was on the street, the snake charmer told me he was immune to his own snakes because of being bitten by them many times. I can do the same for your poison. You would never have to worry about hurting me again," Aladdin said. Jasmine shuddered as Aladdin drew her close. "I love you." Her tail wrapped around him as she kissed him.

No one noticed Fasir simply vanishing. He smiled faintly at Aladdin's words. A small cat with wings popped in. "Oh, this looks interesting," he said.

"As you say," the old seer replied. The winged cat looked at him.

"You play a dangerous game. I like it," Chaos said before vanishing.

Jasmine and Aladdin broke apart. "Come on. Let's go home," Aladdin said.

"Yes. Father should be back from his trip soon. We'll need to tell him what happened," Jasmine said. The heroes walked back towards their home.

But for every choice, there is a consequence. What Jasmine chose will change not just her own path, but the paths of others.

134112222221.content:
The master of all evil watched the images in the orb with a sort of baited breath. In the orb was the biggest thorn ever to be in the side of an all powerful chaotic evil goddess.

Aladdin.

Despite their less than cordial relationship, she did not show anger towards the sleeping figure of the boy. No quite the opposite. It was joy bordering on near ecstasy. Foe you see she was finally implementing what she considered the ultimate plan to not only get rid of the boy, but accomplish so much more.

It was simple really, a mere modification of a plan she had performed before.

With a wave of her arm, an evil mist rushed forward and into the orb.

==================

Within the walls of the royal palace of Agrabah, a street rat slept soundly. His form sunken deeply into the feathery softness he was so unused to still after years of having a rock wall for his back and a ragged shaul for a blanket. The mist seeped through the doorway. Wafting over the rolled up enchanted carpet, and rolling over the brass lamp which had a deep rumbling snore coming from it.

The grren clous was upon its target in seconds, it raised up like a serpent waiting to bite before it lunged forward and shot straight down his throat, his nose, his ears and eyes. Letting itself be totally consumed by the hero of the town instantly.

=============

Mirage licked her lips. This was going to be good.

=============

The changes happened immediatly. His spine stretched along with other parts of him until he towered over Raoul the head guards. His limbs now lanky and awkward....at least they were until muscle started to pile on top of them. Aladdins once gymnastically toned body gained from years of out manuvering the guards was replaced by a mountain of muscle the likes of which would make more sense for an Odiferon. The kind of body Genie gave him the last time he'd tried showing off for girls.

His toned stomach became a rock hard 8 pack, his pectorals swelled up like a sack of footballs. By this point his trademaerk purple coat had ripped to shreds by the way just as his arms bulked up from the shoulders down. His biceps blew up until they were the size of a mans head even when he wasn't flexing. No muscle was spared a size change, from the souls of his feet to the top of his head he was ripped like he could wrestle giants with his bare hands and come out on top.

It was at that point when a golden fur started to sprout all over him, and his face was being pushed out into a muzzle.

==============

The evil incarnate was purring up a storm. Her hands idly drifting.

==============

His teeth grew sharper and longer the further away his mouth moved from his skull. His nose looked like it wasn't being pushed foward as well, but instead like it was stretching, being pulled flatter against his face. The nostrils closed up into slits and the skin around it turned a shade of pinky red just as the fur met his thicker, blackened lips.

His fingernails were pushed of the tips just as iron hard claws burst through, which happened to his feet just shortly after thick, black pads formed on his soles

His fitful moaning in his sleep became a deep masculine growling. He tossed the sheet away when it became to hot to sleep with fur.

Where once a boyishly handsome young adventurer had slept was now an immensely masculine beast man, with extra emphasis on the 'man' part. This figure was large, imposing and dominent. The kind that commanded respect and fear just by being in the room. The one that was in control with no room for arguement.

Mirage licked her lips as she materialised in the room. Just the way she liked it.

Waving a hand over the rooms other occupents she lowered her head onto Aladdins gold coloured barrel chest and rubbed against it, purring up a storm and rousing him from his slumber.

Blearily he opened his slitted eyes. Blinking away the sleep and just catching the powerful evil rubbing her head and her hands up and down him in a slow and loving manner.

She looked up to see him staring at her. Their eyes met.

1341122222211.content:
"Mirage!" Aladdin growled in a deep an undeniably masculine voice that would make any woman quiver. He lifted one of his massively muscled arms and huge hands to shove the dark goddess of his massive pecks, but paused when he saw his hands were furrier than they should have been. His feline eyes trailed down from his hand towards his bulging biceps, herculian shoulders and eventually drew over the rest of him. He barely looked like himself anymore, more like a cross between a lion and that guy in the market with the huge muscles he'd hidden behind the day before he met Jasmine. The bed now felt like it was built for a child where as before it had been large for him. His pants clung to him for dear life, and (he jodtled his hips a little, ignoring Mirages smile as he did so)......daaaaammnn.

Grunting he tried to reach for genies lamp, only for the evil one to lick the spot where his neck met his jaw, causing his arm to drop dead to his side at the intensely pleasurable feeling.

"Mmm you taste good my lover." Mirage said with a smile. Aladdin gulped as he found the smile more arousing than he should have.

"L...lover?! No way!" He said and brushed his long fingers against the magical lamp.

A loud snoring could be heard emanating from it and a whisp floated out of its spout, materialising a small sign that said 'Do Not Disturb'.

Aladdin groaned in annoyance, and then pleasure as Mirage continued her lavacious assault with her tongue, nimble fingers working their way up and massaging his shoulders casing his massive bulk to relax against all common sense to stay ready and alert. He tried launching himself up and off the bed, but that only succeeded in in pushing Mirages face up his chest and brushing her maw against his.

The brown furred feline didn't mix a beat as she nuzzled against his face in a fashion that a being without any real lips would imitate a kiss. The young former thief mind felt like it was fogging over in a pink haze as he felt the passion in her assault, the heat from her loins grinding against the stone elephant trunk in shredding pants and the powerful smells of lilac she was exuding.

"I'm a little disipointed Aladdin." Mirage said with mock anger. "I was so sure you'd put up more of a fight. I didn't think I'd get you into my bed this easily." Aladdintried to glare at her, which would have been intimidating even for her, but for all he was feeling right now it was about as scary as a kittens. Even less so when he tried to command her to change him back, but only suceeded in groaning as he traced the front of his pants.

However Mirage was not a mistress of magic for nothing, she could hear the stray wish to revert in amongst the cloud of growing desires.

"And risk losing you to that little girl? Never" Mirage said smugly, punctuating her remark with another 'kiss'. "Why would you want to return to being such a little boy? When your everything I want in a man." This time she lapped from collar bone to his chin. Causing him to release a moan that what enhanced by his uncontrollable purring.

He could feel everything starting to become a blur. Everything that didn't involve what Mirage wanted was fading away. Her smell, by all that was holy he'd never smelt anything so good in his life, and the thing she was doing to him. Her tongue alone was making him feel things Jasmine had never done.

Part of him wanted so badly to flip her onto her back, mark her as his mate. To take her and make her feel so good she'd spend the next thousand years purring. The problem was that this part of him....was the majority part of him. He'd never wanted anything more than he wanted Mirage right now

He screwed up his eyes and tried to wave away the fog of passion.

"Not you! Jasmine! I want Jasmine" he bellowed. Shaking the room.

"I can see that." Mirage said amused. "Oh wait no I don't. Because its me you want."

"No!" Aladdin shook his head slowly.

"Yes!," She moaned out. There was a tearing sound and what remained of the heros pants were destroyed. The feline deity reaching for her prize.

"NO DO...G! Guh...uh....UH!" Aladdin's last thread of control broke away and any words he tried to say were swept aside as the fog started their final controls

"You have no choice my love. Give into your desires" Mirage said seductively. Aladdin's hands slowly reached up and put themselves around Mirage. One to pull her waist closer, and another started to massage her ass. "You want me. You need me." Her pace picked up as the rumbling in Aladdin's chest grew louder "I'm your world. Your lover, your mistress, your everything." She moaned that out as the lion man pushed her head out of the way and lightly lapped at her neck "We'll spend eternity together. Rule together, bring chaos together." He started pulling himself up and forwards as the masculine purr became a manly growl "Have...kittens....tog....e...th!!!"

She was cut off from the last two letters when, with a deep growl he bit into her neck.

She exploded in pure pleasure. Her breath hitched as far as it would and she went limp, falling back onto the bed....just as Aladdin flipped her onto her back, hovering over her like a looming shadow.

What she looked back up at had no trace of the boy that once was. All that remained was her Aladdin. Her mate.

"Be gentle." She suddenly whispered. Finding herself a little scared of the perfect mass of manhood she had created.

His response was to leap forward and tear her skirt to ribbons

13411222222112.content:
Mirage may have been self described as the ultimate force for bad, but right now she'd never felt more good.

She couldn't stop purring as she lay her head on her pillow, one of the massively bulging biceps of her lover, the transmogrified Aladdin. Both of them laying on a large bed, only the silk like covers and their fur guarding their modesty, the endless rumble of thunder from outside harmonizing with the rumble in her chest and the deep masculine rumble in his.

Her palace was an absolute mess. Everything was broken. Tables, chairs, the walls had deep gouges in them from claws. Their wasn't one solid thing in her dimension that hadn't been torn up in the whirlwind of their frantic passions. Even the bed was torn up, the sheets were so shredded they couldn't make up the scraps for a harem girls brassiere.

She lazily waved a hand.

Tables un-splintered, pages bound themselves back in leather covers, the bed they were laying on refilled with plush stuffing. Everything restored itself.....with the exception to the claw marks in the walls. Let that be a testament to their furious loving. She also left the sheets....because she liked the unrestricted view they gave her.

Oh Chaos she was sore. She stretched her lithe body. Enhanced and built into her ultimate fantasy lover or not Aladdin was still mortal, and she didn't think a mere mortal could make her feel so good.

She inched up, raising herself so her head was in the crook of his neck.

Their was a shifting and her massive love turned to look down at her.

Their was an instant in which she thought he'd 'come to his senses'. He'd through her off and try to race away to find a cure, only for her to catch up to him and seduce him resulting in another round of pure pleasure. So it was both a relief and saddening when instead he reached over with his other arms and pulled her up off the bed, onto his chest and started licked at her neck.

"Ooooohhhh." She moaned. Looking down at him she saw him look up at her with a mischevious expression in his eyes.

She smirked back and reached down his chest and abs. The purring and human moaning turning into screaming and primal roaring not much later

1341122222212.content:
"Mirage!" Aladdin bellowed as his eyes widened in shock. He did not notice his once tenor-like voice was now a deep bass. He shoved one of his mighty mighty arms right into her face and threw the goddess of Evil of his chest. His eyes turned to his furry arm and thick claws extending from his paw-like hand. Looking down, he noticed his whole body was far from human. His feet nearly hung off the end of the bed. Rolling away from where Mirage was pushed to, he reached for the lamp.

"Oh Aladdin, I should have known you would play hard to get," Mirage said with a smile. Aladdin did not look at her. He rubbed the lamp.

"Sorry . . . Al . . ." came what sounded like Genie's voice, "Too . . . tired . . . to , , , come , , , out." Aladdin could only shake when he felt Mirage touch his shoulders. He threw himself forward, off the bed. He landed on all fours but didn't make a sound as his massive form hit the hard stone. His claws dug into the stone as easily as a hot knife into wax. Mirage laughed again.

"I put them in a sleep spell. It will disapate when the sun comes up, but tonight you are all mine," Mirage said. Aladdin turned to face her and glared at her. Mirage flinched just slightly under the powerful gaze.

"Change me back," Aladdin growled. He lifted himself upright and was taken back at how tiny Mirage looked. Normally he was just above eye-level with her. Now he doubted she came up past his large pectorals.

Fear came to him as he realized Jasmine would be equally tiny compared to him.

"No can do Aladdin. The power chose you. You cannot be rid of it that easily," Mirage said. "Besides, why would you want to return back to that runt of a boy? You are so much a man now." Aladdin's nose flared and he shuddered. There was a scent of lilac in the air as Mirage came closer.

He could smell her now. He could smell Mirage and . . . by the maker of all, she smelled intoxicating. Part of him wanted so badly to take her, to bite her neck and lick the wound. To make this feline his. He felt a throbbing between his legs. Oh, did this want to take Mirage so badly.

He shut his eyes and shook his head.

"Jasmine! I love Jasmine!" he roared.

"Oh, you can bring her with us. I wouldn't mind a concubine," Mirage said with a chuckle. Granted, she would break Jasmine by making her watch them have sex but no need to ruin the moment.

"No!" Aladdin yelled. He rushed to the door but found it locked.

"Sorry, no door or window will let you pass through," Mirage said as he got closer.

"I won't submit. I can get to the Tree of Renewal!" Aladdin said. Mirage just laughed some more.

"This magic is beyond that tree. It comes from an era before it. You have no choice but to submit," Mirage said. Aladdin looked to the wall next to him. Then to his muscular body. If he could make those marks in the floor, the wall should be noting. Raising his hand, he slammed the wall and his hand went through. Ripping open a wall, Aladdin ran into the dark hallways.

He didn't even realize he was now on all fours. He did not realize he moved with amazing grace, turning on the spot, and completely silent.

"Curses!" Mirage grumbled. She glared and readied herself to stop him.
1341122222212.title: Will Not Submit

13411222222122.content:
Aladdin did not bother with stopping when he reached Jasmine's door. He slammed his shoulder into the double doors. They flew open as the lion-man entered. Raja rose on his feet and looked at the massive beast.

Raja growled at Aladdin, who returned the growl as he arched his back on instinct. The massive muscular feline looked even larger. The smaller tiger went silent but didn't move.

"Raja, it's me! Aladdin!" he growled. Raja made a confused noise.

"Aladdin?" came the voice of the woman he loved. But it didn't sound right. Aladdin heard double. He looked to the closed canopy bed and out slipped Jasmine, along with Jasmine. Raja turned and looked at them with confusion.

"What's going on?!" the Jasmines asked as they looked at him. His black hair was was still evident at the top of his mane. "You're . . . ."

"A beast man," Aladdin replied. "Mirage did this to me." The Jasmines gasped and put their hands to their mouth. He nodded as he looked at the Jasmines. One had to be the duplicate.

The Jasmines faces contorted from shock to sadistic glee. "And you could have had me, but you picked this foolish girl," the Jasmines said. Uncertainty came to the Jasmines faces as they looked around. They saw each other and jumped back.

"Mirage! What trick is this!" Jasmines yelled. Her face contorted once more.

"My beast man wanted you, and now he can have you," Mirage's voice said. "But which is the real one?" Jasmines' faces returned. They realized the situation and glared at the other.

"I am!" "No I am!" "Your the fake!" "Stop lying!" the Jasmines yelled at each other in perfect synchronization. They turned to the other occupants. "Raja! Aladdin! It's me! I'm Jasmine!"

Raja felt confused. He moved towards them slowly. He kept an eye on both.

"What's the game Mirage?" Aladdin asked. The faces contorted once more as they looked at him.

"Quite simple. Pick the real Jasmine and and I will depart. Fail to pick the right one and she is lost forever in darkness. The only way she could escape is for you to give yourself to me, willingly. You have until sun rise," Mirage's voice said. Aladdin looked out the balcony and could see dawn's slow approach.

Raja was close now to them now.

"Raja!" the Jasmines yelled. "It's me Raja!" He looked back and forth and whimpered in confusion. He wanted to attack the evil Mirage but couldn't tell them apart.

Aladdin walked slowly towards them. Raja didn't come up to his knees. The Jasmines didn't come up to his pectorals. As he looked them in the eye, he searched for some hint, some tell that the one is not the woman he loved. There was no mark, no tattoo, no physical means of knowing this woman wasn't Jasmine. But he couldn't trust that anyway. Mirage was a master of disguise. He needed something else. His chest expanded as he took in their scents.

A field of fragrances filled his faculties. Cinnamon, honey, and lilac came from the one on the right. Cinnamon, honey, and roses came from the one on the left.

His mind flashed back to Mirage in his bedroom. Her alluring scent was coated by lilacs.

Aladdin smiled and was about to speak when his eyes fell on the Lilac-Jasmine. As he bore into them, he felt a cold, emptiness inside. It was buried deep but he could feel it there. He turned his gaze to the Rose-Jasmine. His eyes looked into hers. She smiled, her beautiful smile as horror came to her double but Aladdin shook his head.

"Neither of you are my Jasmine!" Aladdin roared as the sun's warm rays fell into the room.

"Curses!" Mirgae yelled from all around them. The Jasmines shrieked as the sun struck them. They turned black and melted into the ground. Aladdin rushed past them and ripped off the curtains to the canopy bed. There she lay, his Jasmine. He let out a deep purr of happiness. He leaned down. His muzzle was larger as her head itself. He wanted to kiss, but it turned into a lick.

Jasmine smiled. "Raja, I'm sleeping," Jasmine, his Jasmine, murmured. Her topaz eyes fluttered open and looked into the eyes of the Lion Beast Aladdin.
13411222222122.title: Meeting Jasmine

choices: Jasmine touches Aladdin.  Will she feel differently?
Someone comes into the room, spooking Jasmine.  She runs.
134112222221221.content:
"Aladdin?" Jasmine whispered. Aladdin nodded as he saw the woman he loved beneath him. Her beauty, her love, her strength of character. He could hear her heart begin to race. She was accepting of his new body . . . No, she was amazed as the heart was beating so quick.

But something was wrong. A new pheromone came from Jasmine. She was shaking. Jasmine pushed herself away from Aladdin. She was terrified of him. When she reached the other side of the bed, she rolled off.

"What the?" Aladdin growled as he watched Jasmine's backside. A long slender tail protruded out of her. It looked like . . . A rat's tail. Jasmine now stood behind the canopy curtains. "Jasmine, it's me." She nodded.

"I . . I know Aladdin. But when I look at you, I feel terrified," Jasmine replied.

A chuckling came around them. It wasn't Mirage's cold laugh. It was a chortle with a voice the would-be happy couple dreaded to hear.

"Oh, this is brilliant!" came the voice of Chaos. He melted into existence in the middle of Jasmine's bed. "Interesting. Very interesting." Aladdin controlled his anger. He did not want the ire of this being. It could make things far worse than they already are.

"Did you have something to do with Mirage's latest plot?" Aladdin asked calmly. An annoyed look came to Chaos' eyes.

"Please Aladdin, think better of me. I don't do the same play twice," Chaos said. "This was all Mirage. And I must approve with her actions."

"You mean my new form?" Aladdin asked.

"Well, you are a bit too macho for my tastes," Chaos said, "But yes. The way she changed you is certainly unexpected."

"Well, I wouldn't expect you to tell us," Jasmine said quickly. Chaos leered at Jasmine. She looked upon him with some fear but confidence as well.

"Oh, rolling the die with that one," Chaos said. "Are you telling the truth? Or is it a lie? By telling me what you expect of me, are you hoping I do the opposite? Hmmm." He laughed again as he turned himself upside down. "I'll tell you. Mirage put within you a deep prey mentality. You look upon lion-boy and your instincts tell you to run. A very chaotic way to destroy your love. The rat tail, now that is pushing the line."

"And-" Aladdin rumbled.

"Before you ask, the magic fueling this spell comes from you Aladdin. Away from you, Jasmine will be her normal self. Around you, she risks wetting herself from fear," Chaos said. He took in a deep breath as though there were a bouquet of roses. "I so love the smell of fear in the morning. It brings out so much chaos." Aladdin growled a little before he bowed his head.

"Thank you for what you told us," Aladdin said.

"Again, you roll the die," Chaos said. "Thanking me tends to bring unexpected results."

"I assumed as much," Aladdin said. The annoyed look returned to his eyes.

"Hmm. You did," Chaos said. "Well, as your life won't be boring anytime soon, I'll leave. Have fun with your new body Aladdin. And remember, I'll be watching." He vanished, leaving Aladdin and Jasmine in the room. Aladdin fell to his knees, trying to make himself look smaller, less predatory. He could see Jasmine shaking the curtains now.

"Do you still love me Jasmine?" Aladdin asked. Jasmine nodded.

"I do Aladdin. I love you so much," her voice said as it shook. "It's . . . It's just I look at you and I feel such fear of you." Aladdin's ears flattened as a forlorn look came to his eyes. He looked at some point on the bed.

Jasmine looked at the man she loved. She could see the pain this was causing him. "Aladdin," Jasmine whispered. "D-Don't move." Aladdin didn't respond. He didn't move as his love requested. He didn't even follow her with his eyes. He didn't have to as he could hear her walking. She was walking towards him. Walking the circumference of the bed, she inched closer and closer. Four feet away. Three feet away. Two feet away.

"He is the man I love. He is suffering just as much as me. We cannot let Mirage win. He is the man I love . . ." This thought repeated itself in Jasmine's mind. With this mantra, she fought back against the powerful fear she felt. Even as the fear grew with each inch closer, she pressed on.

Raja kept quiet as well. He seemed to understand the importance of this action. He rested back near the damaged doors.

Jasmine pushed out her hand to the mountain of golden muscles. His left arm was just inches away from her now. Her hand was quaking from fear. She could do it. She could touch Aladdin.
134112222221221.title: Unwanted Approval

134112222221222.content:
Jasmine's eyes came into focus. The gold blur shifted into a beast above her. Its sharp teeth inches from her. A deep growl made her almost too scared to act. Then her scanning eyes noticed this beast had what all male beasts had. And thankfully it was within range of her legs.

"Jas-" the beast started to say when she kicked the beast. She rolled away as she was deafened by a loud roar.

"Raja?!" she called out as she raced to escape. Her faithful tiger moved to be by her as the beast man fell between her and the door.

"Jasmine," the beast man growled as he rubbed his sore spot.

-----

Aladdin was at was with himself. He knew Jasmine saw him as a beast first and attacked him to protect herself. He knew it was perfectly acceptable.

But another part of him didn't. The beast inside him, the part that wanted to take Mirage, roared in rage at this insult. It wanted to show Jasmine who was the dominant force, who the leader of the pride was.

"No!" Aladdin pushed back. "We will not harm her!"

Wresting control and feeling his claws retract, Aladdin looked at the terrified princess. Raja was standing between him and her.

Another grumble from his beast about this interference was silenced.

-------

Jasmine watched as the large lion beast fell on his knees. Was he from that valley of animals? What was he doing here?

"Who are you?" Jasmine demanded. "The guards will be here shortly. I suggest you leave before you get killed."

"Jasmine," the beast said, "Please. It's me! It's Aladdin." Shock came to Jasmine's face.

"No," she whispered as the creature nodded.

"Mirage wanted me as her plaything. She turned me into her ideal figure," Aladdin said. His eyes, more feline than he realized, looked at Jasmine.

"If you're Aladdin, then prove it," Jasmine said. She watched his ears twitch at something.

"I first met you in the market place. You had given an apple to a small child and was caught for stealing. I claimed you were my sister and not right in the head. We pretended Abu was the Sultan," Aladdin recounted. He laughed. "It went nearly off without a hitch until Abu bowed and dropped what he had stolen."

Jasmine said nothing as those memories matched hers.

But that meant nothing. Mirage could make duplicates with such memories too.

"You know my past with Aladdin," she conceded. "Raja, is it him? Is it Aladdin?" Raja looked at the kneeling beast man and then to Jasmine. He lowered himself and shook his head.

"Gee thanks," Aladdin muttered. His ears twitched again. Jasmine was right. The guards were on their way. He didn't want to fight them. Not that he was scared they could win against him in this form, but what his inner beast would do to them.

If it wanted to assault Jasmine the woman he loved, then what would it do to the men who chased him for years and continued to loathe him?

He had one last thing to try. Raising himself up to his feet, Jasmine took in his form in all it's power and authority. His shoulders relaxed. A familiar face showed through the furry muzzle as one giant hand extended palm up to her.

"Do you trust me?" he asked.

Jasmine's eyes went wide. She smacked herself but it wasn't a dream. The pose was the same. The words were the same.

"Aladdin?" she whispered.

"Princess?" came not Aladdin's new voice but the voice of Razoul. Looking passed Aladdin, she saw the captain of the guard standing there with sword drawn. "Princess! Stand back! We'll protect you!" He and his men charged in.

Aladdin let out a deep growl as he saw the men rushing at him. He wanted to fight these men for this interuption. But another part knew he couldn't. He had to get out of there.
134112222221222.title: Do You Trust Me?

choices: There is no way. Aladdin the lion man he will be from now on.
There is a way for him to look human, but there is a price to pay.
1341122222212221.content:
Aladdin turned and rushed at the guards. Jasmine rushed after him, screaming for the men to stop, for Aladdin to stop, for some help.

Razoul was the first to meet the new Aladdin and looked up at the bipedal beast. Before his sword could swing, he knocked the Captain of the Guards away like a bad date. His men looked at him with fear.

It felt good. He should be feared. He should be respected. Moving before they could act, his swipes knocked them all down. He let out a satisfied growl when his ears picked up rushing feet. Two sets. Turning around, his eyes saw Razoul throwing his sword at Aladdin. The curved blade flying hard. But Jasmine was running towards him as well. The blade was close to striking her.

Fear fell over Razoul as he watched the princess come into his blade's path. "Princess!" he called out in fear. But then the beast man reached and pulled her in. His muscular arms covered much of Jasmine's back. The blade hit his skin and fell to the ground, clanging about.

Aladdin let out a pained growl with the strike, like being hit with a stone. He wanted to make sure Razoul couldn't get up when he heard Jasmine's voice.

"No Aladdin! Don't fight. Don't hurt them anymore," Jasmine said firmly. He looked down and saw the fiercely determined eyes of his love. The beast stared back.

Razoul watched as the Princess stared down the beastman from within his arms. His men began to rise and grab their weapons.

"No! No!" he called out. His men looked at him and followed their orders. They didn't want to be smacked around like that again.

Aladdin blinked and looked away.

"When . . . When they attacked," Aladdin said. Jasmine touched his muzzle.

"I understand Aladdin," Jasmine said. "Now, let's calmly explain what happened." Aladdin nodded. His arms retracted and Jasmine turned to face the captain of the guards. "Razoul," she said firmly.

"Princess, who is this? What is going on?" he asked calmly. He could see the beast man's chest expanding with each breath.

"This is Aladdin. He was transformed by Mirage," Jasmine explained. "He . . ." She saw the blade on the floor. "Did you throw that at Aladdin?"

"I did, but you ran in the way and he . . . he defended you. It struck his arm," Razoul said. Aladdin's eyes narrowed.

"Of course I would protect her," Aladdin growled.

"Aladdin," Jasmine said firmly. He nodded. "Let me see your arm." Aladdin held out his powerful limb. "Razoul, I don't see a cut." Razoul moved close carefully. He looked at the golden fur and saw no cut, no scar, not even a blemish.

"Neither . . Neither do I," Razoul said.

"Well, Mirage certainly wanted me strong," Aladdin said. He turned to the door as the Sultan and his friends finally arrived.

"Oh-Oh my! What is going on here?" the Sultan asked.

--------

Aladdin sat on Jasmine's bed as she spoke with her father and Razoul in the hallway. He had to force himself to not speak up as he could hear their words. He turned his head to Genie doing . . . Something. He shifted into who knows what as Abu patted the beast man and then ran away.

"Wow. So you handled those guys with no effort at all?" Iago asked as he came back from the hallway.

"Yeah," Aladdin said.

"Aha! I got it!" Genie called out.

"You know how to cure me?" Aladdin asked.

"Nope. But the magic is powerful. Way powerful. Well beyond anything I could touch," Genie said as he took a hammer and tapped Aladdin. "I could no sooner undo this than make Iago a soft spoken gentle soul."

"Hey!" Iago screamed. "I have a good side."

"Yeah, usually when it is surrounded by gold," Aladdin noted. He sighed and rose. He walked to the balcony. He looked down and saw something from behind the bushes. A wisp of a familiar cloak. "Carpet?" he called. The magic rug came over and Aladdin got on. And went no where. Carpet shook in defeat and Aladdin looked down again.

Part of him was scared. Part of him worried about injuring himself. But the beast wasn't. The beast knew this was nothing. The beast told him it would be safe. Growling, he jumped over the edge.

His body acted on its own. His knees bent landed on the ground with a solid thump and small dent. He rose no worse for the fall and looked up. Iago, Abu, and Genie looked at him with slacked jaws. Carpet flew over them and was coming down. Jasmine was on top. Aladdin turned to the bushes and walked.

An old man with white hair, brown cloak and brown sash covering his head. The blind seer being waited still as a statue. He turned only as Jasmine arrived.

"Good day Aladdin," Fasir said. "I see you are well."

"I'm a beast," Aladdin noted.

"Of the body. Not of the soul," Fasir replied.

"Fasir, please. Do you know how to help Aladdin?" Jasmine asked. The seer looked in her direction and them approached Aladdin.

Aladdin watched the man approach and felt something odd. He felt fear. The beast within saw Jasmine and wanted her passionately. The beast saw Razoul and wanted to harm him. To feel fear because of this man just added to the mystery of who he was and what he could do.

"Yes. The magic that changed you is ancient . . . and no cure without wholly exists," Fasir said.

"What do you mean?" Jasmine asked.

"Mirage used a spell to reflect the victim's soul. Aladdin's spirit is strong, fierce, but loyal and caring. He became this. This is his soul unleashed. There is no means to change it without changing who Aladdin is within," Fasir explained.

"Then . . . what about something to give me the appearance of a normal person?" Aladdin asked. "Even being this tall would allow me to pass as normal." Fasir said nothing for a moment.
1341122222212221.title: The Power of the Lion

134112222222221.content:
Genie looked up at his master. Now bursting with muscle....as in he looked like he was about to burst like a squashed grape from all the muscle he'd packed him with. With a thought, he had the girls surrounding him pull their fans around him giving him a few moments of solitude.

A tiny version of the big blue lug popped in, in front of him

"I might have been a little slapdash for the sake of the show. Let's get you fixed."

Aladdin nodded as best as he could with his pecs pushing up against his chin.

Genie cracked his knuckles, rolled up his wrists and shot his master again. He smiled.

His body evened out. The mass of bulging muscles didn't shrink in the slightest, but everything else about him grew. His legs lengthened and bulked up, his hands which looked tiny on his huge forearms swoll up like sponges. His neck widened and shot up so his jaw wasn't smashed up against his giant pecs. His jaw which grew wider, stronger. Manlier

"Here we go, all better. OK girls open em up again!" He told the fangirls before zipping out the back and sliding down Abu's back flintstones style without being noticed.

The shouts of adoration and praise came back.

With a vengeance!

Aladdin looked around trying to keep the confusion off his face. Women in the crowd looks grew more intense, even the girl's genie had popped into existence to surround him withs smiles grew bigger. It took him a second to realize they were no longer on eye level with him. He looked down and saw that his royal garb now tented more in the front than it had.

Genie hadn't 'fixed' him the way he thought. Instead of returning his chest and arms to normal, he'd made everything else bigger! He was huge! A giant mass of muscle! He had to be close to two heads taller than he had been! His head was no longer squashed into his chest because his neck was now longer and as thick as a bulls!

Aladdin looked over himself. At least foot taller or maybe even more. Suddenly Razoul the head guards large and burly physique no longer intimidated him. He had a sneaking suspicion he might just tower over the man now.

He looked back up at the genie on the balcony with the three beauties. There was a time they'd never give him the time of day. That their interest was only for those that could provide for them. Now looking at him with the same level of adoration as the crowd, along with such blatant lust at least one of the triplets was sending him hand signals about what she would do with him if he was here for her and not Jasmine.

Well, what good were these muscles if he didn't put on a show with them?

Smirking he looked up at genie in his harem drag and put out his arms. Getting the message he let the girls 'slip' over the balcony and fall to the crowds gasp. Only to cheer when the three all landed in the prince's big strong arms. Sweeping them up in his arms like a buxom bouquet of roses.

He kept that noble smile firm on his face as they woke up with shock then quickly attached themselves to him so tightly they all but told him they never intended to leave his side ever again. One grabbing his melon-sized biceps and pushing her own melons against it. Her sister crushing herself tightly against his back while wrapping her arms around his neck to keep her from slipping, and the one in red sitting in his lap, tilting her head all the way back to look at him the same expression oh so many men in the past had looked up at her with, grinding her backside into him ever so slightly while doing so and cooing. Continuing to sing about how wonderful and handsome and amazing prince Ali is. All while the crowd cheered and cheered

He could only keep the grin he'd had on his face the entire procession as the people are both real and created continued to sing the praises of the Handsome, generous, adventurous, muscular Prince Ali......not noticing the princess turn back into her room in disgust as the display of womanizing.

134122.title: Bell the beast?

choices: Belle is led to the beasts castle by her fathers horse after he is imprisoned
1341221.content:
Maurice was hardly what you would call a simple man.

He was known as the town nut job due to his passion for bizarre inventions, this year for example he had devised an automated wood chopping machine that wouldsave the time and effort of a person to do it.

He was on version 24 after the last 23 exploded. He had a good feeling about this one.

He was also a very sad man, his beloved wife had past away 20 years ago, his beloved Marie who was once known as the vilage beauty, fighting off boys with a stick had chosen to marry him. Most likly because unlike the other men who tried to impress her with their dashing looks, great fortunes and countless gifts he won her over with her true love, books. Something she shared with her daughter was an unnatural love of books and knowledge. Something unusual for the rest of the village. He was able to earn her love by enjoying everything about Marie, her mind, her humour, her wit and not just her looks.

She had been struck down the night Belle was born, she had just enough strength to name their daughter before passing away, lossing to much blood in the birthing.

Thats when the problems started.

He had been angry, he had been furious. He left Belle with the midwives and rode off into the forest in a fury. He rode for what seems like forever before he almost ran into an elderly woman in the forest.

He normally would had apologised but the fury and grief he had been experiancing was all consuming, instead of an apology he snarled at the woman for being in his way.

That had not been the best thing to do considering she immediatly turned into a beautiful enchantress.

The enchantres had been prepared to cast ahorrible curse of Maurice when she stopped and looked deep within him. This was not the same type of man she was used to dealing with, this was a broken hearted man who was angry from grief. She could not smite someone for being sad, but this man did still need to be punished less him grief consume him and destroy his live.

So he cast a spell, a spell that would force him to live the life he was previously about to abandon. The man was unaffected, but his daughter, his Belle....became a beast.

The girl grew several inchs in mass and sported fur from head to toe, her nose became a black button and she sprouted fangs and claws. Her cries urned to growls.

Maurice asked on his knees why she would punish the baby and not him. The enchantress replied that changing him would only make him sink deeper into his grief, but changing his daughter would force him to live if but for her sake, and for all his anger towards the baby girl the enchantress knew he would not abandon her like this.

Until the day he had truely accepted and forgiven his daughter and himself then Belle would remain a beast.

She would have put a timer on it like she did the prince but it would have been excessive to force a man in greiving to love who he felt killed his wife like she forced a spoiled noble.

Years later Maurice had kept his word. He had stayed and raised Belle, he had bribed the midwives with gold to keep them quiet and brought his daughter up in seclusion. Never permitting her to leave the house. It was a horrible chore to bring up such a girl. Since she was several inch's taller than a normal he had to hand make all her cloths so that the villagers did not need wonder why he also bought womens cloths.

He started raising a few animals so itt would not look unnatural to buy so much food at market, the girl at quite a bit more than he, which was why he bought the cow for when she was young.

Theyre had been a few close calls, her mothers curiouslity had led Belle to try and leave the house more than a few times but so far no villagers with torches and pitchforks had turned up at his door.

It had been difficult but Maurice had raised his daughter into a fine and very intelligemnt young woman.

=====

This would be the first time he had left her on her own for so long, but he needed to show his invention at the fair if he wanted to make any money he needed for a new home. It was getting increasingly difficult for Belle, he and the animals to live in their small house.

"Okay Belle while I'm gone what are you going to do?" The short man said to the enormous girl.

"I won't leave the house dad." Belle said in a tone that suggested she had heard it a thousand times before.

At twenty years old Belle was a giant of a woman, standing a head taller than even the tallest man in the village Gaston. Despite having the strength of a bull she was not overly muscular, in fact she had roughly the same build as her mother, the same face if you look past the fur, fangs, nose, pointed ears and two small curved horns on her head. She wore a blue dress with white blouse underneath, the back of her dress tented slightly in the back for her tail.

"And why shouldnt you leave the house?" He pressed.

"*Sigh* Because theyll chase me down like I was a monster. I've heard it a thousand times dad." She said.

"And a thousand times youve ignored me." Her father admonished.

"Can you blame me?!" She went over to a window and threw open a wooden shutter. "Look at that dad, a whole world just waiting for me to see it but you wont let me! I'm bored out of my mind, I can't stay here forever!"

Maurice sighed and patted hisdaughter in comfort. "Belle, you know you cant leave the house. The villagers are 'still' talking about the monster that turned up in town several years ago."

"I was 8 and wondered were you went."

"Belle." He said with a raised voice.

"I wont leave." She said in a hurt voice.

"Good girl." He said and turned to the door, hefting a large sack behind him. "I'll hopefully be back within a week. Take care."

"Bye dad, love you." She called to him.

"Good bye Belle." He called back, leaving the last part of his daughters call unanswered before closing the door behind him.

Belle sank down into a nearby chair, her golden retreiver Montague walking up and placing his head on her lap for comfort.

Belle looked down at the dog her father had gotten her for the lonliness. "Dont worry Monty, he's only going to be gne for about a week. We'll manage til then."

Oh how wrong she was.
1341221.title: Beast and the Beast

choices: Belle enters the Beast's castle, continuing the search for her father.
Actually, something else happened along the way.
13412211.content:
Meanwhile, Belle was currently outside of her home, despite promising Maurice to stay inside their home and not wander off. Fortunately, she kept her distance from the village, treading through the open fields on the village outskirts.

Due to the curiosity she inherited from her late mother, she wandered into a beautiful valley, overlooking the open landscape, taking in the fresh outdoor air. From there, she picked up a flower near her feet, using her lithe paw-like hands to gently grab the gentle plant by the stem, sniffing it's aroma.

Although she felt relieved to go outside, Belle couldn't help but feel like wanting to be....accepted by the village residents. After all, the memory of her father telling about what caused her to become like this was still fresh in her mind after all these years, as she exhaled a somewhat depressed sigh.

However, she then heard the sound of a panicked bragging horse rushing toward her, as it was revealed her father's horse Phillipe, still pulling the loaded cart behind him when he galloped out of nowhere in a panicked state. But what made Belle greatly concerned was that her father wasn't with the frightened stallion.

Quickly, Belle sprung up onto her paw-like feet, stopping Phillipe since she was just a few inches shorter than the horse, causing Phillipe when he recognized Belle. "Phillipe! What are you doing here? Where's.... Where's Papa?" She said, her voice sounding more concerned with each second, as she gently calmed Phillipe down. From there, Phillipe looked back at the beastly female before him, where Belle asked, "Where is he, Phillipe? What.... What happened?"

Becoming more distressed about her missing father, Belle quickly turned her head back toward her home for a brief moment before resolving to go and search for Maurice, uncoupling the wagon behind Phillipe while she replied, "We have to find him, you have to take me to him." Belle then quickly hopped up onto Phillipe's back, holding onto the reins with her paw-like digits, giving the physical commands for the stallion to move.

===============================================

After some time of searching the vacant woods for signs of her father, Belle and Phillipe made their way through the dirt forest trail. Thankfully, her physical affliction gave her a few useful perks, one of which being an enhanced sense of smell and being able to see we'll in the darkness. Picking up the scent trail of her father, Belle and Phillipe stopped in front of what appears to be a large stone castle wall, completely with a pair of large iron fate doors, and a massive castle on the other side of said gates, all while surrounded by a forest of dead tree's and dog outside of the castle stone walls.

The foreboding atmosphere made Belle feel....uneasy about the area she was currently located in, slowly looking around and asking herself, "....What is this place?" But then, Phillipe started to panic a little, snorting and beginning to buck, almost as if something was scaring him. However, in an attempt to put the horse at ease, Belle discounts herself off of Phillipe, comforting him as she said, Phillipe, please, steady. Steady."

Shortly after calming down the unnerved stallion, Belle approached the decrepit gates, pushing them open with little difficulty due to the rust of the gates hinges, causing this rusting screeching sound to erupt from opening the gates. Once she opened the gates, Belle quickly took notice of the hat belonging to Maurice, lying of the cobblestone ground. Out of worry, she picked up the hat with both paw-like hands, where she then whispered, "Papa...."

With all the evidence, Belle could only come to a conclusion that something's happened to her father, and that he tried to find refuge inside the vast castle standing before her. Left with no other choice, Belle knew that in order to find Maurice, she had to enter inside the castle, unaware of who and what exactly were residing within the castle and it's hallways.
