1352321112.content: As Timmy went down stairs, his parents were waiting for him with a huge meal on the table. "Wait, this is more dessert than usual. What's going on?" Timmy asked his mom and dad. "Well since the whole world is fat now, we decided that we need to make you fatter so you can survive in this huge world." Timmy's dad told his son. "But I'm big enough already!" Timmy protested. "Sure you're big, but compared to everyone else, you're a twig." Timmy's mom replied. "I'm not su-mmph!" Timmy was interrupted by a cake slice stuffed into his mouth. "Trust us son, you're gonna enjoy being bigger. Once you're fat enough, you probably won't have to go to school anymore!" Timmy's dad said. That last bit actually excited Timmy a little bit, so he went ahead with the plan.
1352321112.title: Something else

135232112.content: What if Timmy couldn't unwish turning himself into a girl?
135232112.title: Timantha?

1352321121.content:
Timmy really should have 'read' Da at least once.

For example, he had no idea that true love extended to friendship. Or at least he didn't until it was too late.

He'd jokingly wished to be a girl, well not really but a very offended Wanda to turn his sarcasm into a genuine wish. Transforming Timmy Turner into Timantha Turner. He now she would have been angry but soon realised that this was the perfect opportunity to find Trixie the perfect birthday present since she now thinking like a girl herself. So she tip toed off to the mall while wearing a dress that was far too pink and girly even by his new female standards, but not before gender flipping her godparents in revenge.

It was a sound plan since her new gender had rewired her mind enough to instinctively know what women wanted on a level not even that guy from Thatcherite of the same title could. For example she now had a desire for handbags....lots of handbags...and enough was never enough.

(before I get flamed. That was the answer I got when I told a woman I knew she had too many hand bags.)

While traversing the mall she stopped in front of her comic store and to her relief she found she still enjoyed comics (though now for a similar reason that teenage boys bought she hulk and witch blade). She went to by the latest of her second favourite hero when a boys hand grabbed onto it. They struggled with the issue until the fell knocking the boys hat off and revealing the last person Timantha would ever see in a comic store.

As it turned out, Trixie Tang was a total tomboy! Well technically she liked boy stuff as much as girl stuff but who cares. The girl Timmy liked was into comics, video games and unnecessary violence like he was. Timantha's mind raced with the possibilities. Everyone else at the girls super party would be bringing girl stuff, but if one certain boy brought her that collectors edition crimson chin 1987 Halloween special he had saved away then he'd be certain that boy would have a place in her heart 'and' her Realm of Battle Craft guild for many years to come.

If he even needed to give her that, When she found out all Trixie was really looking for in a guy was someone she could be both a girly girl and a buddy with, someone who would watch soaps with her then play crash nebula and eat pizza with her until they were sick.

He was so marrying this girl when they were old enough.

They’d spent the rest of the day just hanging out. Something he'd never thought possible with a girl. Hitting the arcade (and scaring every boy there) back to the comic sthop (scaring every boy there) the food court (where every boy they scared away gathered round to tell them 'both' they were pretty which sent a chill up Timantha's spine and her stomach to churn even though it was hardened after years of eating her mms cooking). They had a blast til it was time for Trixie to head home and prepare her party, but not before giving her BFF a V.I.P invite and a big hug.

So the soon be a boy again ran home, not all that careful in avoiding her parents since they usually took extreme methods to avoid Timmy. Hey if you don’t see it then it doesn’t exist, and if they’re son didn't exist then that meant they were still childless and could buy that new boat with the fund marked 'Timmy’s college fund' for some reason.

She got the comic and headed back to Trixie's, just short of the house which was lit up like a Vegas hotel with people who she was sure Trixie didn't know were lined up with arms full of presents.

“Cosma, Wando.” She called on her gender flipped fairy’s. The pink haired slob in a wife beater and the checker dressed sixtys rejected poofed into existence in front of her.

“Hey sport.” The female voiced man said, taking a break from chugging back brew. “Ya get everything ya needed.”

Timantha nodded. “Yeah. All girls really want is a guy who isn't afraid to show their sensitive side.”

“And handbags.” Said Cosma in an entranced voice, six handbags on each arms with more poofing in filled with shoes and chocolate. “So many handbags.”

“Yyyeeeahhh.” Echoed the girl before shaking the cobwebs out of her mind. “Now turn me back into a boy. The sooner I'm a guy again the sooner I can go from being Trixie's BFF to just BF.”

“You got it.” They raised their wands which glowed with magical power.

What would happen next in another, more mainstream world was Timantha would be Timmy Turner again, go to the party, proclaim his sensitive side which would work in making Trixie love him...for about a second before being kicked out in fear of what her friends would think, but he would get over it after being set up with dates with other girls set up by their mothers after he visited the women’s salon and impressed them by getting a treatment.

In another world this would happen. However in this world.

*Faaarrtttt*

The girls eyes shot open at the all to familiar sound. The sound she feared almost as much as vicky's shrill voice, which was always accompanied by...

*POOF*

Da rules floated between her nervous godparents. Flipping itself to the appropriate page and showing them all why it caused the wands to make an immature noise.

“Uh Tim...antha? Did Trixie actually say you were her Best Friend Forever?” Wando asked slowly.

“Uh yeah.” She said in a 'duh' tone. “But what difference does tha.........that better not be the rule I think...”

“We can't interfere with true love kiddo.” Wando finished. “And a friendship strong as the one you’ve made with Trixie in only one day falls under this rules power.”

“But, but but but what about my other friends?! If you couldn't break up a friendship any more than you could break up a couple then why didn't it stop me from turning into a girl in the first place!?”

Her two magical parents looked at each other then laughed out loud. “Seriously? A friendship that strong between dudes? Get serious bud!” Wando fell to the ground laughing, while his wife grimaced at her husbands immaturity.

“Besides that. One of those friends of yours seemed pretty keen on getting to know you. And give you that dead frog.”

Timantha's smacked her face. “A.J is in love with me.” She dead panned. Greaaaat.

“So what do we do know?” She asked tentatively. She was a girl, for the foreseeable future she feared as long as her hopeful girlfriend was her best friend and one of his former best friends wanted her to be his girlfriend. The changes weren't retroactive so eventually she'd have to explain who she was and where Timmy Turner went. Her parents would probably want to adopt her as the daughter she knew they always really wanted, compounding the can't break true love rule with paternal love which she surmised was in their if friendship was. Ultimately leading them to be good and loving parents to her which coupled with having a great friend like Trixie and her genius friend tripping over himself for her all added up to what she feared was a happy childhood.

Which meant she'd lose her godparents, trapping her as a happy and not miserable girl forever.

On the other hand......
1352321121.title: Timantha Turner

choices: Trixie invites Timantha to the after birthday slumber party.
13523211211.content:
(had to cut this and the previous chapter into two chapters so I could post it.)

“Next time remember it's gold studded diamonds not diamond studded gold!” The human wall yelled before flicking the small boy off into the distance with no regard for how he landed.

He gazed at the seemingly endless line with a critical eye. Weeding out undesirable and line cutters with a swift and brutal trip on the loserapult. With the money he made working for the Tangs he lived in the slightly smaller mansion next door with his own fleet of luxury cars so forgive him if he wanted to ensure his employment.

He was currently scaring a teen boy with bad acne and a gift was too small for his liking when he heard the unmistakable sound of indignant remarks.

Someone was cutting his line!

“Oh no you don't!” He grunted and reached into the pool of people like someone would pick a hair out of soup. Lifting the comparatively tiny form between his meat hooks and staring at the girl with death in his iris.

He gave her the once over. A brown paper wrapped and very thin parcel between her painted finger that looked like a magazine. He looked at the girl with his clenched teeth. Normally this would make a grown man wet himself, but this sliver of a girl just stared back at his, smirking.

“And where do you think your going girly?”

She said nothing, reaching into her neon pink blouse and pulling out a small pendent. The letters V.I.P spelled out in cut diamonds.

The colour drained from his face like someone had pulled a plug. He lowered the girl back to her feet with a nervous chuckle. Moving aside submissively to which the girl gladly walked past him. He sighed in relief and went back to his job. Tossing another boy into the distance for holding a box of nothing.


Inside Trixie stared out over the throng of people bored. Present mounting up behind her till they reached the ceiling, forcing her father to have the ceiling and roof knocked out for now so the presents could continue to pile. Beside her Veronica yacked on about something or other she didn't care about. To her other side a butler held a pad with the names of everyone the door guard let in. She didn't care. All she really cared about was...

“Hi Trixie.” Her heart swelled at the buck toothed site. A thin parcel between the girls fingers dropped to the floor as the most popular and powerful pre teen girl in Dimmsdale swept her best friend into a sisterly hug. Ignoring of the gasps of shock, of her blond hang on fainting and countless boys wailing in despair at not being the Hugee.

Timantha could only grin. It may not be what she wanted exactly, but until she could figure a way back to normal it was more than good enough.
13523211211.title: Trixies party

choices: The Turners met their new daughter
135232112111.content:
Timantha (hopefully still) Turner wandered home with a huge smile on her face, skipping in a girly fashion since her mind was too far away on cloud nine to care about boyish decorum. 
 
Sleepover. Did she really need to say more? 
 
Allright then. Only her and Trixie sleepover. 
 
Almost immediately after the Tang heiresses public declaration of best friendship the party had shifted into a whole other gear. No longer was the queen of the fourth grade willing to sit in her throne and be brought presents. A DJ sprung up out of nowhere and started laying down some fat beats. A circus troupe burst in and began entertaining the crowds with amazing feats.  
 
Even a truck came by opening up to reveal an arcade for the guys and ponies for the girls....that is the girls who didn't spend the evening competing for the high score of house of the dead while the boys watched in both horror that two girls were owning them and glee that Trixie and her cute friend had suddenly become that much more approachable in their eyes. 
 
Eventually the party died as most of its guests had bedtimes and chores to pay for Trixie's extravagant gifts. Till it was only the birthday girl, her new true BFF and her old fake BFF who was being dragged away by the bouncer while glaring daggers at her usurper. 
 
Timantha had been prepared to go home but Trixie would have none of that. Picking up the smaller girl and carrying her back into the house like one would a doll and plopping her down on the couch in front of a full size movie screen. A bowl of popcorn dumped on her lap just as 'Gore zombies of blood lake 7' started to play. Her....'former?' crush sat down on the other end of the couch now spontaneously dressed in pyjamas, laying back like a guy and flicking the inflated kernels into her mouth with machine precision. 
 
The rest of the night, and she meant the rest of the night was a mix between guy and girl things that in all honesty Timantha wasn't as bothered by as she knew she should have been. One minute they were playing video games and the next she was letting the taller girl do her hair and face. They gorged themselves on pizza and ice cream and fell asleep watching that stupid vampire movie that had Chester’s teeth broken (again) when he publicly said he didn't like it.  
 
It was about 10am when Trixie finally let her go, both girls by that point to exhausted from their all night party to argue. They bid each other goodbye along with the promise to see each other tomorrow. 
 
Timantha's smile at spending a night of fun with her old crush didn't go away....until she realized she was referring to her as her former crush. 
 
“Uh guy.” 
 
Her pink bow,  and green hair clip suddenly sported faces 
 
“Hey sweety.” The temporarily male now female voice of Wanda called from the back of her head.   “You look like you had a blast with the girl of your dreams last night.” 
 
“Yeah. Until she stopped being the girl of my dreams.”  
 
“What do you...” 
 
“I think the The girly girls trying to say she likes boys now.” 
 
“COSMO! That is completely........Sport why don't you look like you want to feed Cosmo to a viscous junk yard dog?” 
 
“Viscous what now?” 
 
H disappeared in a snarling cloud of smoke. 
 
“Because he's right.” 
 
Wanda said nothing as her godchild poured her feeling out. Ever since last night she'd noticed that she was thinking of Trixie less and less as the Girl of Timmy Turners dreams and more as the greatest friend a girl can have. If she'd been a boy there would have been no way those blushers lipsticks would have went near him yet she let herself get dolled up without hesitation. She'd actually enjoyed a sappy movie! The same movie that he'd nearly died of boredom watching when his mom had forced him to go with her now held Timantha in rapt attention like it was the greatest masterpiece ever, she was even crying unashamedly almost the entire time.  
 
“That's not to surprising actually.” Wanda said bored, kind of disappointed that the girl hadn't figured it out. 
 
“What then?! Why do I feel like this!? Why am I acting like I've done this my whole life!? Why don't I like Trixie any more!? And why couldn't I stop staring during that guys 20 minute shirtless scene.” 
 
“Because you wished you were a girl dear.”  
 
“But why.....” 
 
“You wished you were a girl.” She repeated. “You didn't wish you looked like a girl. You didn't wish you were dressed like a girl. You didn't wish for an illusion for people to see you as a girl. You wished to be a girl, completely and totally. When I granted the wish it didn't just stop at putting you in a dress, your brain was rewired to what it would be if Timmy Turner had been born Timantha. A girl who likes boys and not girls.” 
 
“I.” 
 
“I mean didn't you think it was weird when you checked to see if you still liked comics you thought of buff guys in skin tight spandex?” 
 
She blushed at the thought. She regretted saying that out loud. 
 
“It's natural for you to act this way sweety. Just like it's natural it was for the old you to be gaga over Trixie.” 
 
No it wasn't. He wasn't supposed to be a girl in the first place. Thoughts about her liking things like dolls and ballet swam to the forefront of her mind. Of holding A.J or Chesters hand and staring into each others eyes before she violently shook her head. 
 
She needed to fix this! She needed to make the people who would love Timantha hate her. She needed Trixie to hate her. She needed her p-parent to hate her. 
 
Speaking of which. She had finally made it to her front yard, standing just one step outside of the property and staring at it like it was the most horrible thing in the world. 
 
She knew what would happen the second she stepped inside. All she would need to do is say they had a daughter and not a son and they would believe her instantly, because that was what they had always wanted. Timmy turner was the accident while Timantha Turner was their dream.......well then she'd just have to turn that dream into a nightmare. 
 
She walked up the footpath slowly until she was right outside the door, channeling the whiny brats of a dozen MTV specials. Sighing deeply she turned the handle and let herself inside. 
 
Convince the parents that had always wanted a daughter that they really want there un-noticed son back? 
 
Piece of cake.
135232112111.title: Walking home after the party

choices: The next day at school. Problems new and old.
1352321121111.content:
The door creaked open and a head full of finely conditoned hair poked into the house, followed by a pair of nervous blue eyes.

Timantha gulped 'Ok Tim...antha. Just stick with the plan and they'll be begging for Timmy back in no time.'

"Ok....1...2....3!!!"

*SLAM*

The door rattled as the tiny but powerful legs almost kicked it off the hinges. There was a moan from the living room followed by a shuffling of feet before a very uninterested Mr Timmy's dad Turner came into view

"Uh. What's it now Timmy? Your imaginary girlfirend dump dump dump dump dump......."

"Honey whats wrong? Have you forgotten how to go number 1 again?"

"Dump dump dump..." He pointed at the small figure in the doorframe.

"What? The little Girl that look just like like like like like like..."

Timantha smiled evily before taking a deep breath and prepared the biggest scream she could.....when it was driven out of her by a bone crushing hug.

"I I I k-knew it. I've fu-finally woken up" A sobbing Mr Turner blubbered.

"Our nightmare of having a son has finally ended. Our real child has finally come." A wailing Mrs Turner matched her husband.

Trixies best friend absorbed it all as she gasped for breath. Each word an arrow in her heart.

NO! She couldn't give up!

"I WANT ICE CREAM RIGHT NOW!!!" She screamed hard enough to blow her parents away along with the china pots.

The two looked at each other bfore vanishing ou the front door.

The girl smiled at her quick and decisive victory....until she heard a truck backing up from outside, followed by a sudden terrible cold and crushing sensation. She swiftly dug herself out of the semi solid substance and found she had been hit with what looked like 3 tones of every flavour ever made.

The driver, her dad stuck his head out and waved at her. "Sorry it took so long. But nothings too good for my little girl."

Licking a finger covered in chocolate/ pistachio 'Ok try something else'

"I WANNA PONY!!!!" She screamed.

Her mom stuck her head out of the other side of the truck. "Way ahead of you dear." She whistled and suddenly a half dozen equines pop out of the frozen dessert. All shivering from the cold.

"Uh which ones mine?"

"Why all of them.Anything else your adorable little heart desires?"

Timantha stroked her chin a little while a black spotted pony ate the orange/ Pineapple swirl caught in her hair.

"Mmmmmmmm??? Ah ha! I WANNA......"

=====================

"My shiny teeth that sparkle, just like the stars in space...."

Timantha's eyes ticked visibly as she watched the live performance from atop a throne of candy and action figures. All around her friend who not 24 hours ago were partying at the Tang manor were partying harder than ever. Moving along to the beat that the sparkly toothed singer let loose.

The nerds congregated around the the brand new top of the line vz-cube playing one of the games from the massive new selction theyre was, and playing it on a gigantic wall sized tv.

The populars laughed their smug laughter while swimming about the brand new pool, some merely floating about the pool while digging into fresh lobster and whole white truffles.

"How the heck did they afford all this?" She muttered.

"What? This? This is a drop in the bucket to what we have saved away." Mr Turner shouted over the noise. Tearing his eyes away from the performing acrobats to answer his daughter. "We used our 'daughter fund' that we'd been paying into and saving up since the day you were born, but forgot about after all these years of hallucinating that you were a boy."

"Why didn't you spend it when you...though I was a boy?"

Mr Turner just snorted and turned back to the show.

Timanthas groaned and turned back to the show, lost in thought. Pink, green and purple buttons of her brand, fresh from the paris runway outfit looking up at each other in worry.

1352321221.content:
"This is so unfair." Yelled Timmy as he trashed his room. His anger blinding him to the fact that he was destroying all his things.

"Sorry sport, but you know the rules." Said his pink haired Fairy, she waved her wand as he broke each item. Repairing it with a flash of magic.

It had officially been the worst day of Timmy's life.

He got up only to discover that his parents had left to go on vacation for the week, leaving Vickie to look after him for 7 whole days. Literally permiting her to move in for the entire week, she gave him a list of chores that wrapped around the house and deliberatly tied him up and watched him until she was sure he was late for school. Her own being out until they got rid of theur sudden rat problem (heh heh.)

He was given after school detention by the principal, tormented by Crocker who just so happened to be the detention teacher. Had about twenty new F's to add to his collection since the deranged teacher decided to give every test for the year to the class in a single day.

He got rejected by Trixie, and to pour salt in the wound she didn't just ignore him. She handed him a signed petition now turned legal document that forbade him from seeking a relationship with, being freinds with or even going within 20 feet of not just Trixie but any even remotely attractive girl in Dimmsdale for the rest of his life.

He thought it had been a gag until he saw to heavily armed police officers appeared out of nowhere and dragged him away until he was at least twenty feet from away girl who wasn't prettier than *shudder* Tootie. Which suffice to say since the other few girls who was less attractive or even wore braces had moved away made her the least popular girl in school.

The police said to get used to it since she's his only option now.

The girl was estatic. He was not.

Back home was basically a repeat of this morning, except with Vickies dog getting his dinner, while he starved.

Now back to present.

"Why couldn't you guy's do anything. I thought you were supposed to 'stop' me from being miserable!" He yelled.

"Well sport, all that happened today was kinda against the rules to fix." Said the pink fairy gently.

The boy seethed.

"We couldn't fix your love life because we can't intrerfear with anything to do with love. Same thing with Vickies dog since she loves it."

Cosmo continued. "And thanks to all the horrible things youve wished for in the past, the rule book was made bigger just for you. See."

With a poof a massive purple bound book appeared in mid air. It was so thick that it made the old version look like a pamphlet. It flipped open to a certain page were Wanda started to read.

"It says we can't do anything involving our godschilds education."

"But I wished to be smart before." Timmy said behind clenched teeth.

"Yeah, but the way your wish's always turn out it looks like they actually add a new rule every time you make a wish." She said.

"Yeah. Heres one that says you can't be invisible, oh and heres one that says no trading places with animals, and one for..."

In a move that shocked both fiary's Timmy jumped up to grab the book and threw it across the room.

"I'm sick off all these rules! At this rate I wont be able to wish for anything in the first place. I WISH I DIDN'T HAVE TO FOLLOW 'DA RULES!!!'"

Wanda looked at Timmy for a second. "Timmy sweety, you can't just..."

"Done." Said Cosmo raising his wand.

'*Rule-free*'

Wanda and Timmy looked at Cosmo for a moment, not yet caught up with what just happened.

"Did you just do what I think you did?" Said Wanda in a distant voice.

"Yep."

"But how? The rules would have st..........no way." She said before pulling open the book once more and scanning the pages at a rapid pace.

"Wanda whats...." Timmy started before the book slammed shut.

"That would explain it, theres no actual rule that says you can't wish that you didn't have to follow the rules." She said distressed.

"You'd think that'd be rule number one." Cosmo said happily.

Timmy stared at his god parent for a second before an evil smile broke over his face.

"Perfect." He said in a sinister voice.

"........So I don't suppose your going to let the rules apply again are you?" She asked.

"HA HA HA HA!!!"

"Thought not."

1352321221121.title: "Vickie wasn't icky!!!!"

13523212211211.content:
"......."

"......"

".....wow, that whole 'not icky' thing totally went nuts."

The girl brushing herself off was definetly not Vicky, well not as he knew Vicky at least. She was barely recognisable from the monster that spread fear in the hearts of all Dimmsdale's kids.

For starters she didn't have the perpetual look of evil on her face. In fact Timmy could safely say she didn't have a spek of evil left in her body. She had the kind of smile you'd normally only see on cartoon princess's and the eyes that once had the fires of evil in them were now filled with more kindness than he'd ever thought possible for any mortal person to have.

Second of all, she was a knockout! The whole 'icky' part of her must have spread to her appearance because without she had a look that would have he fending guys off with a fiery stick.

Unlike the stick she was before she had curves. Not to go into to much detail but she was pretty much the opposite of what she was before. Her once green t-shirt and black foot emcompassing heans had been replaced by a pink frilly blouse and what should be 'loose' fitting sweats. Her hair was long and luxurious, topped off with a pink bow.

(If you want a good image just go to deviant art and look up 'not so icky vicky')

"Oh dear, I must have tripped on the floor." Vicky said in a voice that sounded like bird song.

She turned to Timmy and smiled. "Hey there little man, how bout I make us some chocolate chip cookies."

Timmy just stared. To freaked out by the total change to move.

That is until Vicky was right next to him with her hand to his forehead.

Not being used to a pretty girl actually being this close willingly Timmy jumped back a little.

"What-what-what." He stammered.

Vicky just put her hand on her prnounced hips and one under her chin. "Mmm, you don't feel warm. Oh well maybe you'll feel better after those cookies. And after that I can take you to go see that new movie Crimson Chin movie you wanted to see."

With Timmy still to freaked out to move Wanda took charge, her vocal chords altered and used her powerrs to move Timmy's mouth.

"Gee thanks Vicky. Your the greatest babysitter ever." Said Wanda.

"Giggle. That's what they call me. Bye." And with that the now good babysitter was away.

Now finally in control of his functions Timmy zoomed over to his fairy wish.

"What gives. I wanted her nice. Not a super model!" He yelped.

"Well sweety." Said his pink eyed fish somehow while in water. " You didn't wish she was nice. You wished she wasn't 'icky'...." She poofed up a dictionary. "....and according to the dictionary 'icky' means eother 'repulsive' and 'distastful' or 'sweet' and 'sentimental'. And since we figured you wouldn't want her to be even less nice we went with the first definition. Getting rid of all the Icky in both mind 'and' body."

"Well that's not gonna happen I......."

"Are you nuts." Blurted Wanda.

"Whaaaa?" Said the boys.

"What?" Said Wanda flatly. "I'm not allowed to think this is actually a good wish. I may not like you rewriting somemones personality but seiously you just turned one of the most evil people in the world into one of the sweetest and nicest beings thats ever existed. And with the amount of work me and Cosmo have put in just for anti-Vicky wish's this is really gonna lighten our work load." Wanda sighed happily.

This time it was Timmy's turn to be unable to counter the arguement. He had to admit having a nice babysitter who makes cookies and takes you to the movies instead of one who dangles you over rabid dog pits was a plus, amd he guessed he would get used to having such a pretty girl over at his house for a month. Even if she did make him uncomfertable since he remembered who she used to be. Awquard.

"Your right. This might turn out to be a pretty sweet wish after all."

"Timmy, How about I order Pizza for dinner?" Came a voice from downstairs.

"And that clinch's it."

13531222211.content:
Someone once said that she was the kind of girl you took home to mother, and if Mother didn't like her? Then forget mother.

If they were ever so lucky to have a chance with her I think every man in that room would not have spoken to their mothers in a very long time.

Angels bust swelled out as she filled the room with soft beautiful and oh so arousing melodies. Floating down from the stage, moving through the patrons as she moved them. Not one man's eye left her while the women never looked up from their drinks.

Her hands moved up and down herself as her watchers followed them, lingering in all the places she wanted them to. She reached out and lifted one older flounders chin with her index finger and then pulling away letting him drop to the table boneless and stupefied.

She eventually shimmed back onto stage, her tail swinging far more than needed. The customers whipped into a wolf whistling frenzy again just like they are every night. Resting back in the giant clam she entered the stage from and lounging back, letting the last few notes of her haunting song take them away before the living couch closed and took away her.

It reopened in back letting the purple blonde out to stretch.

“There's my little money maker. The one who without my little club would be nothing but a seedy bar.” She fought down the urge to shiver when her boss gave her his version of sweet talk.

Kalimari was the owner of the club in addition to being a very well known 'businessman'. Everybody and their Grandmother knew point blank he was the biggest mob boss in the whole of fish city, but without concrete evidence his part in any crime everyone knew he took part in he always got away with it.

Angel had met the literal slimy squid a few years ago when he was looking for acts. She'd turned up and he'd hired her on the spot.

The fact she could sing didn't filter in until her first show.

Since then he, just like any other guy with eyes had made it his life’s mission to make the voluptuous blonde his which went over about as well as you'd think. Under normal circumstances such a....man would peruse more...forceful methods to obtain what he wanted. Fortunately he meant it when he said this place would be nothing without her. The last time she was sick the joint barely made enough to pay the utilities let alone the employees.

“Of course boss.” She said sweetly. Smiling at him and his croonys over her shoulder while she floated by.

“What say for such a stellar performance I...”

“Is he there yet?”

The squids face noticeably soured. His ever present lawyer grasping him by the shoulders and pulling him back then taking over. “Why yes Ms Jones.” He said in a manner to sharp that they split the water with every click of his tongue. “Your guest has been in back for considerable time waiting for your show to end as we agreed upon.”

Her smile turned from mind bendingly seductive to school girl joyful. Taking off like a rocket.

The shark waved after her before whispering to the sulking kalamari out of the corner of his massive mouth. “A seedy bar remember?”

If the Cephalopod had any bones he'd be grinding his teeth now.

====================================================

She put her hand on the door, hand to her oversized chest then pushed.

The guy in the trench coat smiled at her, hand full of flowers.

“Hey Angel. I'MPH!” Whatever he was going to say was apparently less important to her than flinging herself into his arms and pressing her lips to his.

She moaned into his mouth, hands moving around the back of his head to deepen their intimacy while his moved to the small of her back, crushing her assests into his chest. She reaches to loosen his tie before he decides that’s enough and pulls away.

“C'mon Angel you know Kalimari would blow his bulbous mind if we tried that here.”

Her answer was to reposition herself in his arms and resume the kiss “Maybe I don't care.” She giigled between lip presses.

“Sorry about not being in the crowd. But the deal with your boss and everything.”

Her smile turned into a deep frown, crossing her arms underneath her bust pushing it up. “I should be able to see you whenever and wherever I want.”

“Uh huh? And what will you do when they find out the main attraction already has a guy they wish they could be?”

“*Sigh Fine.” She pouted, then immediacy smiled. Ducking behind a screen, her purple dress came off just as a more conservative blue one which made her breasts look smaller came on. Her fin was rolled up instead of flowing down her back and a pair of thick glasses adorned her nose-less face.

“Perfect.” Gil said linking his arm with hers, his infectious smile lifting her frown if only a little.

“Lets just get home.” She said opening the dressing room door again. Brushing her shoulder up against him suggestively “The sooner we go home the sooner I can...get back out of this thing.”

He tugged his collar and smiled. Grabbing around her waist and pulling her close. “No objections there babe. No objections there.”

13532122211.title: She-lion's in charge.

135321222112.content:
Okay, we just need to set the 'episodes' premise and we can get this little slice underway.

So, how's this for an idea: She-Lion, wanting to take a break from her attempt to control Flipside, decides to take a small vacation into the only town she and her group have definitively taken over...
...
At the same time Kidd Video just happens to come across the town...
135321222112.title: It'll start soon, I guarantee it

choices: The Copycats arrive to a grand welcome
1353212221121.content:
She-Lion just couldn't take her eyes away from the screens. The anger that each screen gave her was forcing her to stare. On one screen, she was standing right there on stage. It had taken two hours for her to get her Siamese fur all pampered and ready for the concert. Her gold earring had been polished to the point it would shine each time the spotlight hit it. Her jacket? It was beautiful, of course it always was. At least it was until a soda can flew through the air, tossed by some ungrateful concertgoer no doubt, spilling it's sugary contents all over her body. It took her weeks to clean that junk from her claws alone. Another screen showed security footage of her base, more specifically it showed her and her bandmates coming back in from another disaster of a plan to capture Kidd Video. She-Lion couldn't remember which, but judging by the immense amount of chocolate pudding all three of them were wearing, it was probably Fat Cat's fault that it failed. What she did remember was the bill for dry cleaning that she got back for her jacket. Each screen was the same thing, sure the location was different and the circumstances leading to the scene were as well, but they all lead to the same word. Failure.

She-Lion pressed a paw to her forehead as she finally worked up the power to turn her hovering chair away from the screens. "Easy girl." Pressing a few buttons on her armrest brought out a large makeup kit. She-Lion reached for her blue eyeshadow, hoping that the cream would calm her down. "When you decided to take over Flipside, you knew that there were gonna be some losses. Thank Cleo I managed to steal all this scientific junk from that Master Blaster weirdo before bumping him off, I can't even imagine what not being the leader of this outfit would do to my psyche. Not to mention my complexion." She-Lion pressed another button on the armrest, bringing a mirror out for her to view her application. Magnificent as always. Still, her beauty would mean nothing if she wasn't ruling over all of Flipside and forcing everyone else to admire it as well. But how would she manage that when things kept going wrong for her? Somewhere in her head, she knew bringing Kidd Video into the equation was the thing that made it all worse. Those kids had a simple job, agree to be her slaves/expendable members of her cover band 'The Copycats' and when she ruled Freeside, they would have a reasonable fee for services rendered. She'd still force them to work for her one way or another, but still.

She-Lion's tail kept twitching and curling as she tried to keep happy thoughts. It all just kept driving her up the wall and nothing was making her feel any better. She managed to find some reprieve as the sound of the automatic doors opening forced her attention to something else. In this case, her henchman and the two other members of her band Fat Cat and Kool Kitty.

"What is your will today your feline ferociousness?" The way Fat Cat would just raise her up on such a pedestal, so amusing. Especially when it would cause his shoulder pads to scrape the floor. But Fat Cat's question gave a valid point, just what was her game plan today? Her band didn't have another concert lined up for a few weeks but they already had the artist they were gonna steal figured out.

"You know boys, I think I've been running myself ragged with all of our failures at trying to catch Kidd Video. I say it's high time we had a vacation."

"Finally boss." Kool Kitty adjusted his red glasses as he leaned against the wall. "You're finally taking my advice and learning to relax. And where are we gonna be vacationing too if I may ask?"

She-Lion swirled around in her chair, stopping at the terminal. Turning off each of her embarrassing losses, a map of Flipside showed on screen with a large circle over a small township. "Like I even have to tell you. A few good days of R & R in She-Lion Central is just what we need."

Though not saying a word, the two henchmen rolled their eyes behind their leader's back.

"And I know this is gonna be perfect, because there will be no Kidd Video to spoil our fun."
1353212221121.title: 'Where Everybody Loves Her Name'

choices: The Copycats POV as they enter the city
Kidd Video's POV as they enter the town
13532122211211.content:
Smoke kept pouring out of the Kiddmobile's navigation controls like New year's champagne despite Whiz's best efforts. Though that might have had something to do with the fact it was still speeding down the road as he was fixing it. Carla and and were standing a short way off while Kidd was at the driver's seat. Whiz pulled himself from the controls, his normally bright blond hair and clear glasses covered in blackness. He wiped off his glasses with a pant leg before giving a glare to the band's leader. "Kidd, you think maybe you could stop driving? It's hard enough working on the Kiddmobile without you going faster than nessacary."

"Sorry Whiz." Kidd didn't take his eyes off the road as he kept the Kiddmobile's speed up. "But almost every time we do stop on the road, She-Lion and the Copycats manage to catch up to us. The last thing we want is being unprepared to run if they find us.

"Well it would be a lot better if we could actually know where we're going Kidd." Carla pointed to the screens that, under normal circumstances would be flashing with thier coordinates, but were currently black. "For all we know, we've been driving in circles. Glitter can't even figure out where we are.

Carla turned to the band's fairy friend. Glitter was pressed against the glass, looking around outside. "I certainly can't. I don't know if I've even been to this part of Flipside before."

As for Ash, he had leaned up against the wall of the Kiddmobile, dishing out one of his little improv songs.
"We don't know where we are.
All we know is where we've been.
We keep trying to fix things ourselves,
but it just keeps boxing us in."

"Alright, alright." The Kiddmobile turned off the road onto the grass. "I guess we're pretty safe out here anyways."

"Not like it matters a whole lot." Whiz came out from under the controls again, closing up the hatch. "The main control rod is busted and until we find another one, we're as good as lost."

Kidd climbed out of his seat and walked outside. "Well that's just great. And where are we gonna find another one of those?"

"Maybe someone in that town over there is willing to trade." Carla pointed to a mass of buildings a ways off. The band all looked to one another, it didn't look that far and they weren't exactly brimming with options. With that in mind, the band started hiking.
13532122211211.title: Meanwhile...Kidd Video is flat-out lost

choices: She-Lion marvels at her little city as she goes along
Just as the two boys start to split up...
135321222112111.content:
She-Lion took one last look in her pocket mirror, she had to look good for the masses. Of course it wasn't hard to please them, but that was no excuse for her to not look her best for the adoring public. Even through the thick metal of the flying fortress and the echoes as she made her way to the exit, she could hear the crowds starting to take notice.

As she walked along, two doors to the side of her opened up and her bandmates walked on through. Kool Kitty was slicking his hair back while Fat Cat was holding tightly to a briefcase. Not for business of course, though in Fat Cat's case chomping through everything handed to him with his own special utensils could be considered business. The sounds of the crowd were increasing as the trio marched along. "It's gonna be nice letting our fur down for a few days." Kool Kitty adjusted his glasses as he spoke, "That park they here is so comfy, I could just lay there forever if I wanted to."

She-Lion scoffed, of course Kool Kitty would be that easy to please. "Well, I don't know about you boys, but I'm gonna take my time in the best spas She-Lion Central has to offer. I'll probably drum up extra business just by being there."

"About that..." Fat Cat said through his salivation over his daydreaming about his heavy lunches and snacks to come, "How come you get to have a city named after yourself anyway? When do we get our own your selfishness?"

She-Lion sighed. "Well, you've clearly forgotten that when we took this town over, I gave the two of you a choice. We would either share this city, or the next ones we took over would be yours to claim."

"Well yeah, but we haven't taken any over yet thanks to..." Kool Kitty was stopped by She-Lion grabbing his tie and tightening it just a little too much.

"Don't you even mention those brats Kool Kitty." She-Lion quickly loosened Kool Kitty's tie, believing he got the message. "This trip is supposed to be for relaxing and having a good time, not for dwelling on our failures. I don't want to hear one more word about those meddling kids for the rest of the trip, got it?" Both cats beside her nodded their heads, thankfully that meant they understood. Rather good timing too, the trop could feel the fortress making it's final descent and they had made it to the main exit door. "Alright you two, smile for the crowds."

The three cats set themselves into different poses as the door slowly opened up. The general noise from the crowd quickly turned into cheering, fueling the cats' pride as they put more effort into their poses. Of course, such a thing as too much effort is possible and the Copycats ended up flat on their backs as the light of the town shone on them. She-Lion got up first, not wanting to seem like a fool in front of the people of her little haven. "Hello She-Lion Central! Your stars have arrived!"

She-Lion looked over the crowd as they continued their cheering, her smile growing as she laid eyes on every face. Each of them one that she had seen in the mirror every day when she put on her make-up, because they were all hers. A sea of copys of her, exact in everything but obedience and color in which they were a touch more grey than her. No doubt the real reason the boys were miffed about not having their own towns. But they'll get it someday, and the pride they'd feel watching it happen would be worth it alone. Oh just the memories of how She-Lion had begun the transformation of this town using...

"Miss She-Lion!" A direct call from a copy of her coming right up to the group, possibly the mayor, brought She-Lion of her flashback. The copy bowed before the group, a few members of the crowd doing the same. "To what do we owe this sudden visit from you and your bandmates?"

"It's quite simple dear. My band and I are tired from our tours and need some time to rest our paws." She-Lion patted the mayor on her head. "And I could think of no better town to relax then in good old She-Lion Central!" The crowd cheered once more at the showboating while She-Lion turned to her comrades. "Hope to see you boys again relaxed and ready." A thick smile carved it's way onto She-Lion's face before turning to the crowd again. "And if you treat us really well, then I think we might even give a little impromptu performance. Now who knows where a kitty can get a soothing massage and fur exfoliation combo?" A trio of She-Lion copys came up and led the real She-Lion away while Fat Cat and Kool Kitty made their own way through the crowd and out into the blue and pink lit streets.
135321222112111.title: Copycats of Copycats

choices: Kool Kitty wins the argument, tell the boss
Kool Kitty doesn't like it, but Fat Cat has a point
1353212221121112.content:
The two male Copycats wandered on down the street, their path lit with the neon and streetlights of the city. Taking a glance behind them, both watched as their leader vanished in the crowd.

"Well, it's nice to see her happy." Cool Kitty said as the duo continued on, "And these copy's sure know how to please their stars." As if to accentuate his point, he struck a pose for a few She-Lion clones on the other side of the street. The grey copies of their leader all swooned, dropping down.

Fat Cat nodded, "Yeah. Though I still say her selfishness could have let us have some power in town." Fat Cat looked up to a building they were coming up, a large neon sign of She-Lion giving a thumbs up was in full view. "At least so she's not the only face in town." The two cats came to a four-way intersection, both looking in different directions.

"Well man, the park is this way. Gotta split." Kool Kitty yawned just thinking about his impending nap.

"Yep." Fat Cat licked his lips in his own daydream. "And I'm gonna see a She-Lion copy about a big plate of..." Fat Cat quickly went silent as his vision hit the road leading out of town. There was no way it was them. "I think I really need that meal, I'm hallucinating."

Curious to what his partner was looking at, Kool Kitty gulped. "You ain't man, cause I see em too! Kidd Video!" Kool Kitty grabbed his oversized bandmates and jumped behind a mailbox. "Oooohh, She Lion ain't gonna be happy about this. But we gotta tell her all the same."

"You kidding?" Fat Cat gulped as he peeked at the band. "You heard She-Lion, she won't like us even mentioning those kids. And you know what her shrillness gets like when she's mad." The two watched as the band walked into the city, both shivering. "Besides, who knows? The copys here were pretty good at turning themselves into She-Lion, maybe they'll turn them into her?"
1353212221121112.title: Just as the two boys start to split up...

13532122211211122.content:
Kool Kitty had to admit, he had no retort for Fat Cat. Not just about She-Lion's anger, but the transforming properties of the town. Sure, that first spell required the band to transform a few townspeople at a time, but soon enough the She-Lion copy's multiplied their numbers all their own.

"Alright fine. But when things go south man, you get to tell She-Lion how you let this mess happen."

Fat Cat rolled his eyes. "Fine. Now let's get outta here before Kidd Video sees us." The two cats ran off into the streets.


"Guys...tell me you're seeing what I'm seeing." Kidd Video stared at the large neon She-Lion.

Whiz and Ash were both staring through a few business windows, looking at the grey She-Lion copies that were staring right back with the same bewildered look as them. "If what you're seeing is what appears to be a city worshipping She-Lion, then we are." Whiz took a step away from the glass while Ash was too shocked to say anything.

Carla and Glitter in the meantime were less guarded against the odd sights as a group of four She-Lion copies were walking right to her. "Glitter, where are we?" Carla looked to the fairy friend, who hid behind her hair.

"Don't look at me." Glitter eventually took a peek, though shivered all the while. "Maybe their friendly though"

The four copies stopped in front of the group, the lead She-Lion copy giving a worried glance. "Don't tell me you kids walked all the way down the road?"

"Well yeah, our car broke down and..." Ash barely had time to speak before Kidd covered his mouth.

"Don't tell them too much." He whispered. "This might be a trap." After Ash nodded, Kidd stepped forward. "Well, what if we did? Besides, we won't be staying long."

"Nonsense" The grey She-Lion leader shook her head. "If your car is broken, we can send some She-Lion to bring it. Besides, we're always happy to offer lodging to travelers." The lead grabbed Kidd by the hand, giving him fluttering eyes. "Who knows Mr. Handsome? You might even want to stay for awhile when it's fixed."

Kidd blushed, unable to resist the complement. Even if it was coming from a copy of his band's enemy.

"Girls..." The lead She-Lion pointed to Carla and Glitter, "...why don't you take those two to the spa. They look like they could use it. Meanwhile, why don't I take you boys to the finest hotel in all of She-Lion Central?"

With trepidation and without the direct order of Kidd as he was still being occupied by the leader's buttering , the group split up. The two split She-Lion groups glanced back to one another, winking with devious grins.

Scooby said jumping onto and lying near the foot of the bed. Soon, both have fallen asleep. At around midnight, something strange was happening. There was a bright light beaming through the window, fixating on Scooby. Scooby stirred in his sleep a bit, but finally awoke to the light. It was hypnotizing him as he hopped off of the bed with Shaggy still in a deep sleep. He then opened the window and looked outside. 14133211.content:
"Thank's again." Said the tall man as he vigorously shook the smaller man's arm.

'This man right here? He's my father. Julius. And he's been made a very happy man.

"Your welcome Julius." Said the smaller and younger man with glass's painfully as he bared the handshake.

'This man is doctor Harold 'Harry' Verne. The source of my father's happiness.

"Do you really have to go?" The small boy said next to his father.

'That's me. Chris.'

The other man smiled sadly. "I'm afraid so Chris. I have all I needed now I must go. It's been a pleasure meeting you all."

Chris looked dejected but nodded.

"Bye Doc." Said Julius before letting go.

"Julius." Harry said and bowed his head slightly to the man.

He turned the Chris and did the same. Then he turned to the three standing at the top of the stairs glaring at him.

"Rochelle, Tanya, Drew." He said with sincerity and bowed his head to them as well.

"Just get the hell out of here." Rochelle said venomously.

'The woman's my mother Rochelle. The boy is my formally umblamable brother Drew and the girl is my formally spoiled little sister Tanya.'

'By the end of Harry's week long stay with us. They all hated him.'

'Let me tell you how.'

151331.content:
It seemed like a rather peaceful day. The princess was taking a stroll through the garden, and many many billion miles Samus was relaxing on her ship, taking the day to rest.

Suddenly, an odd portal appeared under both of their feet, they both fell through. They seemed to be in a vortex, the two girls struggling to go back. It felt like a very long fall and they didn't even notice eachother pass by. In mere seconds they both emerged in each others places.

Samus looked around. A small note appeared on the ground in front of her, the same for Peach on Samus' huge ship.

'Greetings, you have been chosen to become part of the universe crossover program. We take two people in different universes and swap their places, along with changing many things about you to become very much like the original habitant. For instance, if you look down you'll see one of the changes we've already made.'

Samus looked down to see a blue frilly dress, rather tight. Along with wearing white arm length gloves.

Peach felt odd and hot wearing this odd pink bodysuit. It hugged every curve of her body, much tighter than her biker suit she uses for racing.

info.brief_description: We all ask it. Now make it happen. Change your favourite book, show, game, etc.
info.description:
This story is your chance to make that what if you were wondering about on your favourite show, book, comic, etc happen. Please note that the interactive story is rated as such because of the free nature of a 'what if'. However here are a few guidlines that I would like you to follow. These guidelines are in place so everyone can enjoy the story.

**1. No gay or lesbian content.**

**2. No scenes of *EXTREME* graphically violent or hardcore sexual nature.**

**3. Try to write at 'least' two paragraphs a chapter unless it's not supposed to be a chapter (i.e more choices)**

**4. When writing in the 'something else' paths please put a chapter before it explaining what your chapter is about and give the option of whether or not the reader wants to follow it ('would you like to follow this story path?' option 1 - yes, option 2 -something else)**

**5. If a game series has a live series or animated counterpart please use the animated part if the game has very little story. (i.e If using pokemon then write about the animated series and not the game because it has almost no story in comparison to the anime)

Anyone who can make a good actual entry which is at least two paragraphs long I will award an amount of GP based on the quality of the chapter with 100Gp being the minimum Options chapters not included.
